description: The vineyard is on typical steep slopes on the north bank of the Douro River with cooler corners for white wine. This wood-aged wine is in a bottle more suited to a liqueur and is impressively rich while preserving its cool feel. The mouthfeel has toastiness and ripe yellow fruits which are cut with a steely texture and pink grapefruit acidity. It's a wine to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Mirabilis Grand Reserva Branco White (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Half-and-half Arinto and Fernão Pires, this ripe wine has lemon and pineapple fruits, along with tangy acidity. A strong herbal character gives lift as well as crispness. Drink the wine from mid-2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2015 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada White (Lisboa)

description: This wine is full and richly fruity. It has a cool feel to it from the proximity of the vines to the ocean, which gives a mineral, crisp character that adds tang to the texture. Acidity lifts the ripe fruit, allowing it to age a few more months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: The white grapevines at Carvalhas are located at the top of the hills that faces the Douro River, which helps retain acidity. This mineral and floral wine is textured,with a crisp citrus and ripe apricot flavor. It is still young and will be better from late 2016.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Branco da Quinta das Carvalhas White (Douro)

description: This is a delicious wine, where the richness of Chardonnay dominates the fresher character of Arinto, resulting in a creamy, full-textured wine with touches of vanilla and ripe yellow fruits. It's well balanced, with the ripe acidity showing well at the end.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Margarides White (Tejo)

description: Very light wood aging gives a complex dimension without losing the ripe yellow fruits that give the wine its rich character. Fresher acidity is integrating well with the spice and vanilla. Drink in 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Maria Gomes and Bical, this soft, resiny wine has an intensely dry character. Apples as well as raisins give an intriguing set of flavors. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança Reserva Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A light, modern, just off-dry and fruity wine, freshened by bright lime and apricots, with a tang of orange zest. This is crisp, very clean, a good apéritif drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2008 Espirito Branco White (Tejo)

description: A blend of four Vinho Verde grapes, this dry wine is crisp and spicy, with an herbal character. It has bright fruitiness, plenty of acidity and a crisp, tight, mineral aftertaste.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after a local landmark, this is rich for a Vinho Verde, a soft blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura that brings out white fruits as well as a more citrus character. It's very aromatic, fruity and worth keeping a few months.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2012 Torre de Menagem White (Vinho Verde)

description: Six months barrel aging have given this wine richness and spicy texture. It is rounded, full of peach and white fruit flavors and with a complex texture. It's still young, drinkable now but much better from 2016.
title: Luis Pato 2013 Vinha Formal White (Bairrada)

description: Rich and perfumed, this is a full, ripe and creamy wine. It's full of almonds and peaches that are cut with acidity. It's dry and ready to drink, and should pair well with a variety of foods.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2011 Dona Matilde Branco White (Douro)

description: A dry Vinho Verde that has crisp citrus as well as riper yellow fruits. A blend of Alvarinho with Trajadura, it comes from the north of Vinho Verde. It's perfumed, fresh and crisp while showing a full texture. Drink starting in late 2014.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2013 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: With soft acidity, this is already an attractive, warmly white wine. Orange and tangy citrus flavors are balanced by a light touch of wood aging that gives spice. It needs a few more months, so drink from the end of 2014.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2012 Três Bagos Branco White (Douro)

description: A creamy, Chardonnay-like wine that is rich, open and generous. It has weight but keeps a sense of proportion with its balancing texture of fruit skins and herbs.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2008 Monte de Peceguina Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged wine is now mature. Along with spice and toast, it also has an oxidative character that gives softness and warmth. Its rich flavors are full bodied, bringing out citrus and intense acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Andreza Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: The wine has power and considerable wood flavors at this young stage. It also has concentration of white and yellow fruits, well laced with acidity. Powerful while always balanced and stylish.
title: Luis Duarte 2009 Rubrica Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A field blend of old vines from Castro's Quinta da Pellada, this is an impressively rich and concentrated wine from a warm vintage. The fruit is ripe, with peach and mango flavors, the acidity laced with this richness. A hint of wood adds further complexity.
title: Alvaro Castro 2009 Quinta da Pellada White (Dão)

description: A old-vine blend of Encruzado and Malvasia Fina, this is an important wine. It has density, spice from wood aging and a wonderfully perfumed character from the Malvasia. The wine is structured with its concentrated fruit and toastiness. It needs to age and should not be drunk until 2018. Decant before pouring.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Pedro & Ines White (Dão)

description: The wine is rich, bringing together two great white grapes. Both give the ripe smooth texture, while the Alvarinho also brings in its crisper charms. Pear and green-plum flavors dominate this intense and concentrated wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Old vines give this ripe and fruity wine both concentration and a fine perfumed character. With a short six months in wood, it's smooth, creamy and rich with apricot and mango flavor, needing some aging. Drink from 2018.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a spicy, nutmeg-flavored wine. Its wood aging plays well with the aromatic fruitiness that brings out yellow fruits as well as light acidity. It needs no aging.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Terra D'Alter Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A pale yellow-colored wine, it's full of ripe white peach, melon and plums. It's rich but also shows bright acidity and a touch of citrus. It's an easy wine to drink now–2016.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Pancas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A light hint of toastiness gives this wine complexity. Balanced and beautifully ripe, offering notes of apricots and fresh acidity, it's a pour that can be drunk now and will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a rich, smoothly textured wine. Pear and apricot fruits are blended with shots of lemon to give a perfumed wine that has a lightly spicy character. Drink this ripe wine from 2017.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2015 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: Perfect apéritif Vinho Verde, light as a feather, attractively laced with citrus and peach flavors. It has a light prickle on the tongue, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Salsus Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This intriguing blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdelho is surprisingly effective. It benefits from the ripe, perfumed character of the Verdelho which dominates the palate. There is background freshness given by the Sauvignon. It's a ripe, full-bodied wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2014 White (Península de Setúbal)

description: With some Chardonnay in the blend, this is a wine that combines a toasty character with rich yellow fruit and green plums. There is a good tang of orange zest that brightens the aftertaste of this rich wine.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2010 Malhadinha Branco White (Alentejano)

description: From the south of Vinho Verde, close to the Douro, this is a lively and fresh wine, bright with acidity and lifted by its prickle on the tongue. It is dry, although a soft touch of baked apple gives a gentle, fruity aftertaste.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2014 Conde Vilar Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is full of pure, fresh and crisp fruits that are delicious, fragrant, perfumed and lively. With a mineral edge, tangy texture and tight final acidity, it's a wine that could age for a few years
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a tight, mineral-driven wine that's very textured. Its fruitiness comes from quince and pear skins with a definite structure. It is young, most likely requiring aging over at least 18 months.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 Quinta da Garrida Reserva Branco White (Dão)

description: This wine is soft and creamy with melon and green apple flavors. Light, fruity and crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bonavita White (Lisboa)

description: Richly ripe wine, dominated by sweet yellow fruit, although with a fine line of acidity that brings a greener element. Wood spice comes through on the finish of this full-bodied wine.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 Branco White (Douro)

description: This fruity, crisp blend of local white grapes offers a touch of vanilla as well as creamy white stone fruits. It is juicy, full of acidity and minerality. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Rounded and smooth, with some Alvarinho in the blend (which explains the regional appellation), giving weight, full-bodied richness to go with bright green fruits. There is just a final touch of wood.
title: Poeira 2009 Pó de Poeira Branco White (Duriense)

description: Wood-aged wine, very rich and opulent. It has great layers of spice, guava, sweet nectarine, along with a light citrus touch. It feels high in alcohol, which is a shame.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2009 Olho de Mocho Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Richly wood-aged, this is a serious white wine. With spice and light toast allied to the ripe tropical and yellow fruits, it needs aging. Juicy acidity cuts through the full body, giving a lift of citrus to the rounded, opulent fruitiness. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Marquesa de Alorna Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This wine gets its name from the fossils that abound in the landscape of the vineyards. A blend of Arinto, Viognier and Chardonnay, it is ripe and perfumed. The texture is smooth, but with a mineral edge. Yellow fruits dominate the flavor profile that's balanced with acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Stones & Bones White (Lisboa)

description: This partner of the red Grilos is intense and fruity. It shows fresh acidity while also having ripe apricot, tangerine fruit and a lightly mineral texture. It is still young, so will be better drunk at the end of 2014.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Grilos Branco White (Dão)

description: This ripe, fruity wine has a hint of wood, fine acidity, a soft, creamy texture and an attractive burst of lime juice flavor. The finish is warm and rich, marked by good acidity.
title: Campolargo 2010 Diga? Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A field blend of old vines, this wine is fresh yet rich. It has considerable complexity with crisp lemon, kiwi and orange fruits. It is still developing and will likely be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Seacampo 2013 C.A.V. Vinhas Antigas White (Dão)

description: A smooth, creamed apple-wine, ripe and delicious. It has a sweet feel to it, the acidity just giving a bite. A great apéritif.
title: Campolargo 2010 Entre II Santos White (Bairrada)

description: While the wine has weight, it also has intense mineral structure. It piles the citrus flavors over more notes of apples and apricots, a medley of fruits that are shaped into a firm, concentrated structure. The wine has acidity along with a light toast edge.
title: Alvaro Castro 2011 White (Dão)

description: A perfumed, floral white, its citrus character is laced with flavors of apricot and green plums. This is a summer day's wine with a cool, refreshing feel to its smooth and ripe texture.
title: Niepoort 2010 Tiara White (Douro)

description: Crisp, fresh, unoaked wine, with green plum and red apple flavors. It's lively, smooth and creamy, with delicious finishing acidity.
title: CARM 2006 White (Douro)

description: The stupidly heavy bottle is off-putting. That's a shame as the wine itself is ripe and impressive. Rich lemon and pear fruits go with touches of wood spice and a mineral texture. They blend well in a full and generous wine that is now ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Grand Reserva White (Douro)

description: Fruity and light, this is a Vinho Verde that is on the light, sweet side. It has ample acidity to go with the sherbet flavor. This ready to drink wine would be a good apéritif.
title: Vercoope 2012 Pavão Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Perhaps with a nod to the battlefields of the Napoleonic wars fought in this region north of Lisbon, this is a crisp, apple- and lime-flavored wine. It has bright acidity and a delicate texture, with notes of pear skin and grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Forgotten Field Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This wood-aged blend of Arinto and Chardonnay is a fine contrast between the round toastiness of the Chardonnay and the fresher, tank-fermented Arinto. It works to give a ripe, full wine that is textured, with ripe apple flavors lifted by acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: From a 34-acre vineyard on the high plateau above the Douro river, this wine is delicious, fruity and creamy. It has a crisp, fresh feel, light and bright while also full of ripe white fruits, apples and pears. Drink now.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Encruzado and Gouveio, this is a soft, creamy and fruity wine. It has no wood aging, emphasizing the ripe apricot and pear fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Mondeco Branco White (Dão)

description: This is a ripe, creamy blend of Arinto, Viognier and Verdelho. A lightly perfumed character as well as a crisp texture. Yellow fruit and bright acidity are in fine balance. Drink now.
title: Tahora 2015 Ares de Medeiros Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Balanced fresh wine, full of mango, guava and pineapple flavors. It has freshness, brightness, along with a refreshing citrus burst.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2009 Guadalupe Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This chalky-textured wine has bright, citrusy acidity to contrast its warmer tropical fruit character. Balanced and fruity, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2015 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: A rounded, soft wine, hinting at some minerality, with a white stone fruit flavor, crisply citrus. The wine only gradually shows more fruit flavor, the roundness then freshened up with acidity. There is a good final balance.
title: Herdade Grande 2007 Condado das Vinhas White (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and tropical, this is a full wine that captures the warmth of the Alentejo. The acidity offers some freshness along with the citrus edge, but the fruits are much more tropical, rich in mango and lychee spice.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2007 Defesa White White (Alentejano)

description: Floral, aromatic and light in texture, this has attractive prickle on the palate, with sweetness on the finish. A fine summer quaffer.
title: Lagosta 2011 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is richly textured and full of ripe fruits. Crisp acidity contrasts with the warm yellow-fruit and ripe red-apple flavors. It is already a refreshing crisp wine with a fine dense texture. Drink from late 2017.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2016 Golpe Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced from vines in the heart of Dão, just south of Viseu, this is a rich, ripely tropical wine. It has a great perfume from the Malvasia Fina in the blend, along with fresher acidity. Generous and full in the mouth, it is delicious and ready to drink now.
designation: Paço dos Cunhas de Santar Vinha Contador
title: Dão Sul 2013 Paço dos Cunhas de Santar Vinha Contador White (Dão)

description: Tightly herbal and packed with green fruits, this is a full and ripe wine. It is still very young with its initial fruit flavors still intact. It will calm down over the next few months and be better to drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Espirito Lagoalva Sauvignon-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: A blend that is dominated by Arinto, this is crisp and lemon flavored with hints of riper yellow fruits. It has a lively, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Rotas de Portugal Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a bright, fruity, off-dry wine that is crisp and clean. It has a fine light touch of acidity and white fruits. Aromatic and attractively perfumed, it is ready now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Xadrez White (Vinho Verde)

description: From high-altitude vineyards, this is a crisp wine with fine acidity and white fruits. Light, bright and deliciously fruity it has a tangy, very drinkable aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Lab Branco White (Douro)

description: Alvarinho and Chardonnay are the chosen grapes for this blend. As its name suggests, a salty taste from the ocean spices up the ripe yellow and green plum fruits. It's soft with a fine balance of acidity and a soft honey touch at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: A golden-colored wine, it's perfumed and rich. The wood aging shows strongly along with the delicious, fragrant fruits. Toasty and ripe, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Julia Kemper Wines 2011 Julia Kemper Branco Reserva White (Dão)

description: From selected grapes, this partially wood-aged wine is a rich take on Vinho Verde. It has weight and a fine creamy texture. The acidity and the orange zest flavors are filled out with ripe apples and green plums with just a hint of toast. Drink from late 2017.
title: Casa do Valle 2016 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a smooth creamy blend of Viosinho, Alvarinho and Chardonnay. It is delicately poised, just hinting at vanilla while really emphasizing the crisp, clean and refreshing fruits. Acidity and a final orange zest flavor give it a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Dory Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: This crisp and fresh wine suggests citrus and green apple fruits. It is light, fragrant and ready to drink with its bright final acidity.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto produces a rich and creamy wine with pear, ripe apple and apricot flavors. A floral character gives extra piquancy.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo)

description: An attractive, simple wine, with the freshest of citrus and melon flavors, pushed through by crisp acidity and a final hint of almonds. Screwcap.
title: Monte Largo 2008 White (Estremadura)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: A cool, crisp and fresh wine that also has enough weight to go well with food. It has lively lemon, plum and red apple flavors. A touch of steely character lends great shape to this ready to drink wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal White (Tejo)

description: This is a smooth, creamy wine, with apple and pear aromas and flavors, as well as a crisp texture. It's full-bodied, very fruity and ready to drink, with bursting freshness and lingering acidity.
title: Quevedo 2012 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a perfumed wine, its freshness leaping from the glass. It has crisp green and white fruits, lively acidity and a light, tangy character. The finish shows more richness and a dry, textured feel.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 White (Tejo)

description: This is a tense, textured wine that is still young. Bright, tangy acidity is balanced by apricot and pear flavors, bringing out a delicious yet refreshing character. The wine needs a few more months, so drink from 2016.
title: Quevedo 2014 Claudia's Branco White (Douro)

description: This classic blend of Douro grapes is soft, fruity and fresh. It has a mineral edge to the texture, giving a tangy character as well as a more complex set of flavors to the palate. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2016.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2013 Piorro Branco Colheita White (Douro)

description: This is a rich and smooth wine that has the lightest hint of minerality. Ripe yellow fruits and elegant green plum and citrus flavors give this wine both a fruity character and a fine texture. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive, aromatic blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz. It has a softly citrus character with riper, fuller peach and pineapple fruit. It's full, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A fresh, citrus-flavored wine that is all about fruitiness. It is light, bright and tangy with orange and lemon zest. It is floral, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Foz 2014 Vinha da Foz Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a rich wine, smoky with vanilla and apple flavors. It has some good intensity, as well as a textured character that gives it some aging potential. Bright, fresh acidity cuts through the riper fruits. Drink now and until 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This comes from a field blend of old vines. It has a crisp and herbal character that is still young and still very fruity. Tangy and zesty, the wine is concentrated while also light and bright. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe, rich and creamy, this is a dense wine from the lees aging. Spice and a touch of toast come from the wood aging that smooths the wine and gives it extra complexity. This is a rich wine, with a tangy aftertaste, that is ready to drink.
title: Borges 2015 Reserva White (Douro)

description: A ripe straw-colored wine, it has a good freshness and attractive green acidity. There is a hint of vanilla as well as apple and pear fruits. It's fruity and ready to drink.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2012 Monte da Peceguina White (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and rich, it's full of tropical fruit, pineapple and mango flavors. Fresh acidity balances the full fruitiness. The aftertaste brings out a more mineral character.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a blend of Chardonnay and Arinto that was matured in wood. It shows ripe tropical fruit flavors that combine with toasty notes of oak to give a wine that is smooth, rich and creamy. The wine is still young, and will develop a richer character. Drink from late 2016.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2014 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine with tropical fruit tones, a light mineral texture and fine, crisp acidity. From vines planted at 1500 feet above the river, it is fresh, cool and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive wine that is given a perfumed lift by the inclusion of Malvasia Fina in the blend. It is fresh and young, emphasizing the crisp character and chalky texture typical of the Douro whites. The wine is cool, fruity and will be better enjoyed from summer of 2016.
title: Rozes 2014 Terras do Grifo Branco White (Douro)

description: Wood-aged, sophisticated wine in homage to the present Countess of Santar. This is beautifully smooth with just a hint of oily texture, lime juice and sweet melon flavors. Worth aging another year to bring its great flavors together.
designation: Casa de Santar Condessa de Santar
title: Dão Sul 2009 Casa de Santar Condessa de Santar White (Dão)

description: With a high percentage of Malvasia in the blend, the wine has an attractive floral character that softens and fills out the mineral texture. It is crisp while ripe, finishing with vibrant acidity. Drink now.
title: Poças 2015 Poças White (Douro)

description: A lemon flavored wine that is soft and fruity. With its zesty, tight texture and really crisp acidity, the wine is lively and crisp. Drinkable now, it will be better from early 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Lois White (Alentejano)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue and mineral texture, this is a crisp, dry wine. It is floral with pineapple and bright apple flavors. The acidity and the tangy orange zest all add to the freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Vila Nova 2015 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Almost cool in character, this crisp Douro comes from high-altitude vineyards. The grapes yield a fruity citrus- and pear-driven wine that's minerally, with just the right amount of acidity to push its freshness forward.
title: Aveleda 2012 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a light and fruity wine from J. Portugal Ramos. It's crisp, with lemon and citrus flavor, and bright with grapefruit acidity. Drink now and over the next year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very tropical and aromatic, this is a powerfully rich white. It is tangy with sweet oranges, layered with pineapple and apricot. There is a spicy, peppery character that comes from the alcohol.
designation: Serras de Azeitão Selecção do Enólogo
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2012 Serras de Azeitão Selecção do Enólogo White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Smooth caramel and raspberry flavored wine, with a fat, full texture. The wine misses out on fresh acidity, but certainly has ripe fruit richness.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Serras de Azeitão White (Terras do Sado)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: A perfumed wine, it has a rich, rounded character packed with yellow fruit. Layers of wood add complexity and density. The wine is named for the white owl found in the nature reserve close to the vineyards.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba White (Tejo)

description: Made from Cerceal, this is a delicious wine, lifted by some wood flavors giving a creamed baked apple flavor, with white currants and a final, refreshing burst of citrus.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2008 White (Beiras)

description: The rare Codega do Larinho grapes make up half this rich, perfumed wine. Touched by the wood aging, it is both fruity and has more complex toast and almond flavors. It's ripe but could do with a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This crisp, citrus and pear-flavored wine from native Portuguese grapes is very ready to drink with its bright acidity, mineral texture and juicy aftertaste. It is a fine apéritif wine that's fruity and fresh.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Alabastro Roupeiro-Fernão Pires-Antão Vaz White (Alentejano)

description: This light and fruity wine has fresh acidity as well as lemon and ripe pear fruits. It is soft, smooth, and with a creamy texture, is very ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Viosinho and Viognier are the principal grapes in this blend. It is fresh and very crisp. Lively acidity with a lightly perfumed character and touches of apricot. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of two of Vinho Verde's richer grapes results in this concentrated full-bodied wine. It is smooth and rich with fruit flavors ranging from citrus to apricot. The acidity is cushioned by the ripe texture. Drink this serious from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Avesso-Alvarinho Colheita Seleccionada White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is soft, a gentle meander through white fruit flavors and light acidity. It has an attractive fresh character at the end.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Dona Maria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: With its fresh prickle on the tongue and off-dry character, this is an easy, lemon-candy flavored wine that is best drunk young and well chilled. The finish is fresh and crisp.
title: Quinta de Lourosa 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a warm, soft wine, with an edge of citrus alongside ripe apricot and juicy pear flavors. It is round, smooth and ready to drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2013 Adega de Pegões White (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: While this wine has eye-watering acidity, it also has a sweet backdrop of fruit candies and lemon tang. It is ready to drink.
title: Lago Cerqueira 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A local blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is soft, fruity with pear and melon fruit. It has gentle acidity and a crisp texture that gives a lift to the aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A smooth and creamy wine, this shows warmth that is balanced by a brighter, crisper lemon and green apple flavors. Already attractive with great fruitiness, it is refreshing while textured and likely to age well through 2016.
title: Quinta de Covela 2013 Escolha White (Minho)

description: This blend of Viognier and Arinto blends the apricot flavors of the Viognier and the fresh steeliness of Arinto in a bright while rounded package. It's fruity, touched by vanilla and herbs and given a final boost with crisp acidity. It's ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2013 Lybra White (Lisboa)

description: There is a strong sense of herbaceousness in this wine. A blend of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Alvarinho, it is fresh and crisp with lemon and pear flavors. A short wood aging has allowed the wine to round out and get a toasty feel. Drink from 2015.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Quinta da Bacalhôa White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine abounds with spice and ripe pear, peach and mango fruits. The dense texture comes from aging on the lees for four months, adding to the richness and spicy character. Drink this wine now, but it will be better in 2015.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This is a deliciously ripe and fruity wine. Citrus and apricot and peach flavors are given a lift by a nutty, toasty character. It is rich and full, with minerality and acidity shooting through the attractive aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2014 Golpe Branco White (Douro)

description: A ripe and creamy blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is both fresh and richly textured. It has weight as well as a smooth texture, full in the mouth while also tangy. Already delicious, it will also age, so drink until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal White (Tejo)

description: The Encruzado and Malvasia blend is both fruity and intensely perfumed. It has a touch of lychee as well as crisper grapefruit. Drink the wine starting now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Altimo Branco White (Dão)

description: Half-and-half Alvarinho and Trajadura, the wine is dry, crisp and with just a touch of fizz. Grapefruit and lemon flavors mingle with softer apples to give a bright and lively wine that is just made for summer food. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Aromas das Castas Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Flavors of pear and white peach drive this clean, fruity wine. It has a tang of citrus and acidity that adds a lively edge. Ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a fruity, full wine that is dominated by Arinto, giving fresh, lemon and apricot flavors. It is crisp, lightly textured and offers a bright tang of zest and acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva White (Tejo)

description: A lively crisp wine, flavored with soft pear, green plum oregano, streaked through with vibrant acidity. It's light, fresh, ready to drink.
title: Caves Primavera 2009 Primavera Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A ripe, full-bodied and spicy wine, defiantly dry, with a tight acid character. Aromatic fruit finish with intense perfumes, so that the wine is both rich and fresh.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of Roupeiro and Alvarinho (the two varieties in the name of the wine), this is a smooth wine, ripe with bright fruit and acidity. It has a crisp flavor that balances the warm fruitiness. Ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 2 Duas Castas White (Alentejano)

description: Fermented and aged in wood, this rich and complex wine is still young. The potential of the ripe yellow fruits, tight structure and toast and spice flavors are all there. Rounded and generous, this is a wine for some good aging; drink from 2017.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Reserva Branco White (Dão)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is soft and round in character. It has light spice and warm yellow fruits, as well as sliced apple and acidity to balance the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Reserva Viognier-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: A modern, superfresh white, as befits the Australian background of winemaker Peter Bright. It has lemon and pear fruit, attractive acidity and a zingy orange zest texture. Drink now.
title: Terra d'Alter 2010 Fado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A tangy textured wine that is impressively fresh for such a hot region as Alentejo. It has a crisp texture that is balanced by a touch of vanilla as well as freshened with citrus and green apple flavors. It is fresh and very drinkable at this young stage. Wait a year until 2017 and it will be even better.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This is a fresh wine with attractive ripe fruits. Apples, bitter orange and a streak of citrus are coupled with pineapple acidity. It's a well-made, immediately drinkable wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, citrus-driven wine. Its acidity is just right, fruity while well integrated. Some sweetness at the end makes it fine for apéritif drinking.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, fruity and off dry, this is a typically fresh and light-hearted Vinho Verde. Attractive apple and lemon flavors shine through the lightly prickly texture. Drink immediately.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: There is plenty of lively acidity in this crisp, light and fruity wine from the Fino family based in northeast Alentejo near the Spanish border. It is fresh, perfumed, full of hedgerow fruits, lemon and lively acidity. There is no need to age this delicious wine, drink now.
title: Monte da Penha 2013 Montefino Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Cigarra, a cricket, is common in the Lisboa vineyards. The wine has a good mix of citrus and yellow fruit flavors, crisp and ripe at the same time. An attractive chalky, steely feel comes through in the acidity and the tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cigarra White (Lisboa)

description: Earthy, youthful aromas lead to a wine that's ripe while still finding its fruity character. The potential for the citrus and apricot flavors is there and should develop by mid-2015.
title: Quevedo 2013 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: This medium-sweet, fruity wine is both light and crisp. Attractive acidity contrasts with the sparkling texture and the sugared citrus. It's very ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Vilacentinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fruity and soft, this appealing wine is ready to drink. Lemon juice and lime zest give freshness along with bright acidity and a light sense of mineral texture.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Dine with me Tonight White (Tejo)

description: With a blend that includes the Encruzado grape better known in the Dão region, this is a full-bodied, wood-aged wine. The acidity contrasts with the toast and ripe yellow and citrus fruits. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: This is a young and fruity wine that has the rare Vital grape in the blend. It is crisp although with an attractive creaminess that gives the wine a smooth texture. The acidity and red apples are balanced and make the wine ready to drink.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fernão Pires with Sauvignon Blanc allows the second grape's herbal nature to shine. So it is crisp, citrusy and with intense acidity. The wine has a ripe feel with hints of tropical fruit at the end. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Fermented in amphora in the traditional Alentejo style, this old-vine wine has a naturally oxidized character. It is a yeasty, ripe wine that is reminiscent of dry Sherry or Jura's Vin Jaune while preserving fine freshness. It is certainly a food wine, ripe and laden with apricot flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2013 Branco de Talha White (Alentejano)

description: Full and ripe, this is a lemon and crisp apple flavored wine. There is a hint of toast from the six months in barrel that also adds a little pepper. Fine acidity and a tangy texture suggests it could age. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: This fine ripe wine is smooth and rich. Its acidity and apple-fruit aspect is balanced by richer yellow fruit and a touch of almonds. Drink this finely made wine now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)

description: The two grapes here are more commonly found in the Douro. Here in the south of Portugal, they give a softer character—less mineral more ripe apple and pear fruitiness. The aftertaste does keep the delicious wine bright and lively.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Duas Castas Roupeiro-Viosinho White (Alentejano)

description: A blend dominated by 80% Viosinho, this wine is cool. fresh and fruity. It has a light herbal character that contrasts with the apricot and pear flavors. The citrus acidity completes an attractive, balanced wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires, this crisp, lightly herbaceous wine has a soft texture and attractive, creamy acidity. Hints of yellow fruits come through deliciously at the end.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Tropical and citrus fruits complement each other in this soft and fruity wine. It has some richness and a tangy texture of orange peel, which give it a balanced character. Drink now, although the wine will be better in 2016.
title: Casa de Vila Nova 2013 Visconde de Garcez White (Douro)

description: In a richer style of Vinho Verde but nevertheless retaining plenty of cool, fresh characters. The wine has vivid grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors, rounded out attractively.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is light and bright, with crisp acidity and the fruitiness of an attractive, early-drinking wine.
title: PV Vinhos 2010 Egle White (Douro)

description: This is a bone-dry, piercingly fresh wine. It has tense acidity and a mineral texture that would make it delicious as an accompaniment to seafood. The wine is crisp, refreshing and bright.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Vinho Verde)

description: This lightly wood aged Douro blend is certainly rich, full of generous white stone fruit as well as melon. With its balancing acidity, the wine is both rich and crisp and will be better from 2017.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Branco White (Douro)

description: Winemaking at the aristocratic Santar estate is run by Global Wines. This rich wine, dominated by the high-quality Encruzado grape, is poised between crisp apple fruitiness and toast from wood aging. At two years old, the wine is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2015 Casa de Santar Branco Reserva White (Dão)

description: After 14 months in large wood barrels, this wine is full of spicy flavors that go with the rich yellow fruits, generous apricots and peaches, and delicious acidity. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Quanta Terra 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This fruity, unoaked wine is bright with citrus and crisp apple flavors, lightly perfumed from the Verdelho and Cerceal grapes in the blend. It's a refreshing wine that is ready now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Porca de Murça Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Maria Gomes, here is a ripe wood- and apricot-flavored wine. It is full, spicy, livened by crispness from a red apple skin texture. The vanilla from the wood adds a delicious richness to this impressive wine.
title: Aveleda 2007 Grande Follies Quinta da Aguieira White (Bairrada)

description: This is a fresh and bright wine. It has tangy acidity, a citrus character and a zesty aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2015 Bastardo! Black Edition Branco White (Tejo)

description: A blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, this is very aromatic, full of citrus flavors, crisp and clean. Light, refreshing, quaffing wine. Screwcap.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Cortello Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The most successful wine in the medium-sweet Portada range, with its light honey and lemon flavors, both crisp and soft, ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine, sumptuous in its smooth and creamy texture. It has citrus, lime and really fresh acidity to balance the toast and rich fruitiness. Elegant and worth aging further. Drink from 2016.
title: Quanta Terra 2013 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This field blend is produced from old vines. It is rich and smooth with touches with spicy wood. The wood is showing strongly, perhaps not leaving enough room for fruit, however, that could improve as the wine ages more. Wait until 2017.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Fugitivo Garrafeira Branco White (Dão)

description: Lightly wood aged, this is a rich wine that has tropical fruits as well as toast and pepper from the alcohol. Unfortunately, there's a streak of citrus that sits awkwardly with the rest of the wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Judeu 2012 White (Douro)

description: A sweet, soft, clean wine, anonymous almost. Yes, there is freshness, lightness, but all the time the awkward, unbalancing sweetness pulls it down. Drink very chilled.
title: Lagosta 2008 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: This simple wine is all about crisp citrus and apple fruits that keep it bright and lively. It offers a tight texture and good fruitiness at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: A fruity blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, the two most familiar white grapes of the region, this wine is soft and creamy. The acidity and the green fruits are already refreshing. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Ardósia Branco White (Tejo)

description: Not many Douro whites get the heavy bottle treatment like this fine wood-aged wine. It is a half-and-half blend of Gouveio and Viosinho, ripe and with layers of toast and intense yellow fruits as well as citrus acidity. It is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2014 Carvalhas Branco White (Douro)

description: This crisp, lightly sparkling, off-dry Vinho Verde offers attractive acidity and bright citrus flavors, with hints of apple and green plum. Light and fresh, it's ready to drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is fresh, aromatic and so crisp. Made from Fernão Pires and Verdelho, it is ripe with apple flavors and tangy with orange zest. The wine is young, fruity and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo)

description: A blend of Gouveio and Verdelho, this is a spicy, perfumed wine that has fine, lively acidity to go with its honey, lemon and pear flavors. To drink now, although the mineral edge suggests aging potential.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 2 Duas Castas Gouveio-Verdelho White (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Rabigato and Códega do Larinho grapes brings out the crisp acidity of a Douro white. The wine has a fragrant character with hedgerow fruits and white flower aromas. The aftertaste goes more towards yellow fruits while keeping all the freshness.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2014 Passa White (Douro)

description: Just off dry, this is a bright and crisp wine that bounces round the palate. It is summer apéritif time with this vivid, pink grapefruit-flavored wine.
title: Aveleda 2009 Fonte White (Vinho Verde)

description: A mineral textured wine with stone fruits and attractive fresh acidity, it has a lively citrus character that comes out of the bright citrus and green plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2013 Vargosa Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive wine that is crisp while also having a soft background texture. It is fruity, perfumed and balanced. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Tres Castas White (Vinho Verde)

description: An off-dry pair with the rosé in this range, this is a soft white wine that is clean, fruity with attractive sweet pear and quince flavors. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This has soft, ripe fruit, with notes of lime and orange zest fitting easily with the ripe peach and melon flavors. This is warm, rounded and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Portada Winemaker's Selection White (Lisboa)

description: An easy focus on fruit and flavor is the key to this ripe wine that is full of creamy apple and peach flavors. It is crisp, with plenty of acidity and a delicious, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: Packed with ripe fruit, this wood-aged wine is dense and rich. A blend of Arinto and the Douro's local white grape, Rabigato, it is full of the ripest yellow fruits, laced through with stony minerality. The acidity and the spice from the wood give this wine its aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Vines grown at 1,800 feet give this wine its cool climate attitude. The granite soil gives a strong mineral character to the grapefruit and green apple flavors. With its textured almond and spice character, this is a ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 douROSA Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a grapefruit- and apple-flavored wine with a lively prickle on the palate. Bright and dry, this is sharpened by a citrus flavor and acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2011 Paço de São Lourenço White (Vinho Verde)

description: Quinta da Lapa has plantings of the rare Tamarez grapes that have gone into the blend of this wine along with Arinto. It is perfumed, ripe and fruity with a touch of spice and citrus and yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: Floral, aromatic and light in texture, this has attractive prickle on the palate, with sweetness on the finish. A fine summer quaffer.
title: Lagosta 2011 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A fruity blend of four local Alentejo grapes, this wine is soft and smoothly rich with fine acidity and a mix of yellow fruit and apple flavors. It has plenty of crisp acidity to bring out a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This rich wine is made from old vines in a field blend. With its intense acidity and ripe apple fruitiness, the wine is full and concentrated. The spice and toastiness are at peace with the fruit, giving a balanced wine that will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Lacrau Old Vines White (Douro)

description: This is a shade off-dry, with ample crispness, a bright, prickly lightness and delicate texture. It's a great apéritif style, with its soft edge and easygoing freshness, that's ready to drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Vilacetinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: This smooth, rounded wine has touches of wood aging, along with a herbaceous character just now beginning to soften and fill out. It has a light touch of spice along with apple and tangerine notes. Ready to drink.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2010 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: This full-bodied selection hails from the same region as Vinho Verde, offering creamy apricot and ripe white-fruit notes. It has great depth of flavor, with toast and spice tones as well as fragrant acidity.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Minho)

description: Simaens has produced a ripe style of wine here. Apple and rich citrus flavors add a delicious touch to tropical fruit flavors. This wine is fit for drinking in the next few months.
title: Borges 2011 Quinta de Simaens White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft and herbaceous, this is a warm wine, its acidity leading to apricot and pineapple flavors. The apple skin texture and the tangy final acidity make it crisp.
title: Quevedo 2011 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura from vineyards in the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is rich, aromatic, creamy. It has the right prickle in the mouth, with a final lemon peel character.
title: Provam 2010 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a light, fruity, fresh and clean wine. With lemon and crisp apple flavors, it is bright, simple, attractive and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Dão)

description: Young and fresh with an attractive prickle on the tongue, this medium-sweet Vinho Verde is well cut with acidity. Accented with apple and citrus, it is bright and ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: FVine 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: As always, Loios is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink young. With peach, grapefruit and red apple flavors, it's a soft wine with a crisp streak. It is ready to drink now and will be better at the end of 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A ripe wine dominated by tropical pineapple and fresh peach. This warm, lively and fruity wine can be drunk in 2014.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: With the lightest, freshest tingle on the tongue, this is an off-dry wine that is crisp and fresh, combining citrus with sweetness. It is light-bodied, bright and ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Encostas do Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe and creamy wine. It has light acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors and a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Arinto-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: This gently wood-aged wine has spice and toast flavors over ripe mango and guava that are cut with a tight band of citrus. The wine is rich and full, finishing with just a lift of acidity.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is rich, with an attractive acidity to go with the citrus and green-fruit flavors. A delicious tang gives lemon and orange-zest flavors and some minerality. Drink from mid-2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Branco Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from Fernão Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)

description: Vines in the southern Amarante region of Vinho Verde give this wine its ripe melon and apple flavors. It is tangy, bright with ripe fruit and with a lightly mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Portal da Calçada Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe blend of fresh apple and lemon fruits give this wine is crisp, dry character. It is packed with acidity, orange and lemon zest and has a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: One of the most familiar Vinho Verde brands in Portugal, this wine is medium sweet with a light prickle on the tongue. It is fruity with creamed apple and citrus along with a touch of honey. The wine is crisp and clean, delicious to drink as an apéritif.
title: Borges NV Gatão White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)

description: As befits a reserve wine, this blend was aged in wood for six months. That has given a ripe lightly toasty character to the wine along with its cool crispness that reveals its origin in the mountainous northern Alentejo. The wine is fruity with lemon and melon over the wood. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Herbaceous and richly crisp, its acidity is tangy with mineral undertones and bright green- and white-fruit flavors. This is delicious and fruity, with a great final zing.
title: Duorum 2011 Tons de Duorum Branco White (Douro)

description: Attractive and herbaceous, this has an apple flavor that's laced with a citrus note. Fresh and crisp, it's fruity, forward and can be consumed now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is floral and aromatic, bearing soft, ripe yellow fruit, attractive acidity and a soft, rounded texture. A shaft of citric acidity cuts through the palate, making the wine feel lively and refreshing.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Caiado White (Alentejano)

description: Wood aged, this has rich, perfumed and rounded fruits that give a beautiful, creamy texture. There is a light tang of acidity as well to give freshness. Still young, this fine wine should be drunk from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Ribeiro Santo Vinha da Neve White (Dão)

description: A new release from the joint venture between Quinta de la Rosa and winemaker Jorge Moreira, this is a beautiful wood-aged wine, with delicious tropical fruits as well as a tense young structure. It has fine acidity that cuts through the rich fruitiness and the tangy texture. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2014 Passagem Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: Full-bodied and ripe, this is a rich, generous wine that shows complexity as well as subtle fruitiness. A blend of Viosinho and Verdelho, it's full of tropical fruit flavors, with ample weight and concentration. Spicy accents, a dense texture and a fine, long-lasting finish are all part of this stylish wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: The blend of local Douro white grapes gives a soft wine that has a fine streak of freshness. Citrus is balanced with white peach and shot through with mineral acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Rede Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of two really local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is a fresh, mineral and citrus driven wine. It is so light and crisp with acidity that shoots though the wine. From high altitude vineyards, it has a refreshing, cool aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)

description: This rich, oak-aged wine is so smooth with yellow fruits, with just an edge of citrus and spicy, toasty character. It's a beautiful, generous wine, opulent in its ripe fruit while keeping a cool, salty character. The wine is still young, needing to bring out even further flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2013 Branco White (Beira Atlantico)

description: Very rich, ripe wine, full and round in character. It has spice from wood aging as well as almost-sweet yellow fruits. Pineapple acidity does give some balance to this powerful white wine.
title: Herdade dos Grous 2010 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Honey and tropical fruit aromas open the nose, leading to the palate that is warm and ripe with pineapple and white peach fruit. The bright acidity lends a fresh and crisply fruity finish, with notes of citrus and apple.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Monte Mayor Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Partly a blend of old vines in a field blend, this fruity wine with its tropical aromas and pink grapefruit and pineapple flavors is crisp and taut with a mineral texture. It is intense, the fruitiness given a firm shape by the tangy acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2016 Pôpa Branco White (Douro)

description: A spicy, perfumed blend of Encruzado with Malvasia and Gouveio, the wine comes from 35-year-old vines, simply fermented in stainless steel. It is ripe, packed with fruit and delicious to drink.
title: Vinha Paz 2016 White (Dão)

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this fruity wine is deliciously refreshing and crisp, with great acidity. It is bright with lemon acidity finished with pink grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: From a 34-acre vineyard on the high plateau above the Douro river, this wine is delicious, fruity and creamy. It has a crisp, fresh feel, light and bright while also full of ripe white fruits, apples and pears. Drink now.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Branco White (Douro)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has seen some wood aging and that seems to miss out on fruitiness. It has toast, a burned character and a taut texture. The rest of the wine is bland.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: With strong wood-aging flavors, this is a full, very ripe and concentrated wine. Coming from old vines, it has depth of flavor, both fruity and rich. Peach and pear flavors dominate, along with spice from wood aging. The wine needs some aging, so drink from 2015.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva White (Douro)

description: This sophisticated wine is full of rich, beautifully integrated tropical and citrus fruits enhanced by an elegant use of wood. It feels rich, sumptuous and concentrated, while allowing for good acidity at the end. Drink from 2015.
title: Fiuza 2011 Ikon White (Tejo)

description: An easy, fresh, slightly sparkling wine with pleasant, soft, lightly sweet fruit flavors. It is clean, a great apéritif for a summer's day.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A full rich and ripe wine that has toast as well as juicy citrus and yellow fruit flavors. It's a young wine, full of crisp fruitiness that will soften and fill out. With its mineral texture, typical of Douro whites, it is a wine for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Conceito Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is rich, bringing together two great white grapes. Both give the ripe smooth texture, while the Alvarinho also brings in its crisper charms. Pear and green-plum flavors dominate this intense and concentrated wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: With attractive lemon flavors within a smooth and rich wine, this is both bright and ripe. It's aromatic and full in the mouth, showing apple, peach and mineral tones. Drink from 2015.
title: Kopke 2013 White (Douro)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this Alvarinho specialist. A blend with Trajadura, it is crisp, light and bright. Tangy orange and lemon zest flavors give the wine its tight, lively acidity and refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Provam 2015 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: A lively, fresh wine, whose wood aging has just enhanced the delicious fruit flavors of mango and pineapple. The acidity bounces up and down, vibrant and crisp. Considering its origin in one of the hottest regions of the Douro, this is impressive.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Côa White (Douro)

description: A freshly textured wine that has a bite of spice to contrast with its tangy lemon acidity. It's fresh, fruity and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2011 Crasto Branco White (Douro)

description: Aging on the lees for a few months has given this fresh white wine also richness. It has lemon juice and crisp apple flavors and a bright mineral acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fernão Pires and Arinto are blended together to yield this ripe and warm, while also poised wine. It has pear and creamed apple flavors that are shot through with orange-zest acidity. Ready to drink in six months.
title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada White (Tejo)

description: Bright, lively and fruity, this is a delicious, crisp, dry Vinho Verde from the north of the region, close to Spain. It has citrus notes, a bright texture, lively acidity and a touch of spritz.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2012 Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fruity, full-bodied wine, with tropical fruits, pear and sweet orange flavors. The acidity is just right, but richness is where this is going.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marques de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: The apricot notes of Viognier come through strongly with this smooth, ripe wine. It has a steely character and a cool freshness from the Arinto and Síria in the blend. All in all, an attractive wine that could age a few months.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very fruity, this is a dry wine, with green fruits, citrus and a tangy character. It is light, bright and fresh, very ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a creamy ripe wine, spicy and toasty in character with rich Chardonnay and local grapes to give a balanced texture. Acidity is there along with pineapple and white peach flavors. The rich rounded texture is generous and opulent. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Terras do Anjo Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2015, this brand was the among the first Douro still wines. This Reserva, with its wood-aged flavors, is rich and full of ripe white fruits while not losing sight of the mineral texture of white wines from the region. While it is drinkable now, it will be much better from 2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Although it's young, this wine has seen some time in oak, which has given it a ripe fruity character balanced by toast. It's rich and full with balancing acidity and a spicy aftertaste. It needs to age a few months, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A soft, clean, fruity wine, with spice and a fresh, aromatic character. The lemon and white fruit flavors are in an easy, apéritif style, with a lightly sweet aftertaste.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada White (Dão)

description: With great fragrance and just a touch of spiciness, this is full-bodied ripe wine. Along with the more exotic flavors, it has intense apple and nectarine fruit, and a bright, tight texture. Drink now, or age for a year.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Branco White (Dão)

description: A light and fruity style of Vinho Verde, its acidity balanced with pear and white-currant notes. Lemon flavors cut through, adding brightness.
title: Vercoope 2011 Terras de Felgueiras White (Vinho Verde)

description: This superrich blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Roupeiro was tank fermented to keep the crispness and fruit of the blend. It is certainly rich but it has fine acidity as well—juicy and full of apple flavors. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Luis Duarte 2016 Monte do Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires is soft and bland. Its light fruit and acidity feel open and ripe.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: Soft, light and fruity, this wine is ready for a warm day. Apple flavors and clean acidity balance its soft sweetness, making it ready to drink now. Intriguingly, its label resembles that of a much more familiar brand of Vinho Verde.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe yellow fruits and light almond flavors, a rounded and soft texture. This is a wood-aged wine, the vanilla toast giving a smooth structure. while leaving the concentrated fruits firmly in charge.
title: Sogevinus 2009 Curva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A wood-aged wine, with the wood flavors well balanced with crisp acidity. Lemon, peach and melon flavors mellifluously combine to give a rounded wine with a tang. It shows a strong mineral-textured aftertaste, a product of the granite soil of the vineyard. Drink this richly flavored wine now.
title: Quinta de Arcossó 2011 Branco Reserva White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: There is something of the essential crispness and green fruit character of a Vinho Verde. But the wine also has some richness, weight, and a creamy texture. Very aromatic, this is a wine to drink and also age a few months.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Maria Papoila Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: There is a crisp spring in this wine— light and bright with great acidity and a touch of sweetness. It has a light prickle on the tongue that adds to the liveliness of this attractive wine.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe blend of local Douro white grapes, this is attractively soft and fruity. It has a warm, creamy texture that encompasses the young fruits. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ready to develop for a few more months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Porrais Branco White (Douro)

description: A deliciously fresh wine, the bright acidity coming from green fruit and peaches. A creamy character adds a sense of roundness, but there is a crisp, taut aftertaste.
title: Kopke 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Melon and ripe pear flavors give some richness to this lightly citrus flavored wine. With attractive acidity, it is crisp, clean and tangy at the end. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

description: This is a perfumed, lightly herbal wine. It has fine acidity with the crisp fruits and a touch of minerality. Floral aromas and citrus fruit give a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2015 Pacheca Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: Initially fresh, with a creamy, white-fruit texture, this has acidity, but it finishes fat and rather hot, with pepper.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2006 Visconde de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Selected from barrel tastings, this mineral, vibrant wine demands aging. The flavors are bright white fruits, with a tropical touch, followed by a dense biting texture. Final grapefruit acidity tops this ageworthy wine.
title: Niepoort 2009 Redoma Reserva White (Douro)

description: The family-owned vineyard of Santar is run by Dão Sul. This white has plenty of the mineral texture of the region, along with a rich, fruity character. Orange zest, refreshing acidity and bright pear and green-plum flavors come together. Drink from 2016.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Branco White (Dão)

description: Crisply fruity, this light, bright wine is designed for immediate drinking with its acidity, lemon fruits and lightly herbaceous touch.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2013 Comporta White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Tight and textured, this is a mineral structured wine. Green fruits and acidity keep the wine fresh. The aftertaste is flatter, not bringing out enough fruit.
title: Herdade do Perdigão 2013 Villa Romanu White (Alentejo)

description: This well-balanced wine is rich, just off dry and with a mineral texture. Plenty of freshness with a crisp aftertaste balances the softer side of the wine. It's for immediate drinking.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright, fruity and fresh, this familiar Vinho Verde brand does exactly what it's meant to do: provide a refreshing, light glass of wine. Apples and citrus easily carry the lightly sweet flavors and blend with an orange zest texture. Drink immediately.
title: Aveleda 2013 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lemon flavored, this light and fruity wine has a hint of minerality, followed by a crisp, fresh aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sobreiró de Cima 2012 Santa Valha Branco White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: An off-dry, crisp and very fruity wine that has a light lilt of freshness. The wine is just sparkling, giving an attractive burst of apple and citrus at the end.
title: Sogrape NV Mateus White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and smooth with light toast blending with the yellow fruit and spice. Acidity gives the wine its freshness contrasting with the complex fruit and wood balance. Drink this fine wine from 2017.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Quinta do Mondego Branco White (Dão)

description: A sweet wine that has a candy shop confected taste. It does have acidity along with a touch of citrus although the sherbet aftertaste is off-putting.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Ela Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Smooth Chardonnay-like richness gives concentration to this magnificent ripe wine. The wood aging shows through the fruit, ending on toast, spice and green herbs.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: The wood aging of this wine has given a lightly oxidized character. It is rich and creamy with toasty acidity as well as yellow fruits. Drink now.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires is aromatic and ripe. Its fruitiness is tropical, with pineapple as well as apricot flavors. It's softly textured  and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco White (Tejo)

description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp, citrus and green plum flavored wine. The tight texture gives a fresh character that also has some minerality. Lively and bright at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: Named for the Servite convent in the town of Borba, this fresh, crisp and tangy wine is citric, with almond and apple overtones. It's young, fruity and made for immediate consumption.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: With its typical prickle on the tongue, this is a medium sweet wine. It's clean, crisp and citrusy, with sliced apple and orange zest flavors. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp and herbaceous, this is a green-fruited wine that's light on the palate, offering delightful refreshing acidity. This is very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: The light prickle adds to the natural freshness of this lemon-sherbet-flavored wine. Very crisp and light in the mouth, this dances on the palate with just a touch of sweetness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Salsus White (Vinho Verde)

description: A warm wine, open, broad and soft with just some mineral texture. Flavors are of quince, sweet white plums, with some final green, herbal character.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passadouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, this combines a creamy texture with bright green fruit acidity. There is weight as well as freshness, the aftertaste rich while also crisp.
title: Provam 2009 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: Now in a smart clear blue bottle, this is Aveleda's estate wine. It is always a classic, with just some extra weight to give it distinction. The flavors are apple, brightened with lime, finishing with vibrant acidity.
title: Aveleda 2009 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is floral and aromatic, bearing soft, ripe yellow fruit, attractive acidity and a soft, rounded texture. A shaft of citric acidity cuts through the palate, making the wine feel lively and refreshing.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Caiado White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this is refreshingly fruity. It has pineapple as well as citrus flavors, an attractive blend of freshness and crispness. The aftertaste is bright, full of lively acidity.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Maria Mora Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is soft and smooth with yellow fruits and a light texture. It is ripe, generous balancing fruit against the rounded perfumed structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: The wood fermentation has just brushed the ripe notes of this wine, rounding out the young, fresh fruitiness. It's a full wine with pear, citrus and a tangy, mineral texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Reserva White (Douro)

description: With a typical touch of fizz, this wine is fruity, light and bright. It is dry, very fresh, full of apples and lime juice. Refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Cruzeiro 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light and bright, this is a totally approachable wine, crisp and lemon scented. With a lively texture, it dances out of the glass, a wine to drink now.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2012 Rufo Branco White (Douro)

description: Ripe and perfumed, this has great fruitiness and crisp acidity that suit the delicate texture. The wine is completely ready to drink.
title: Pedra Cancela 2013 Seleção do Enólogo White (Dão)

description: This is aromatic and, yes, exuberant in its bright fruitiness and total freshness. It's crisp with a cool character that is expressed in the layers of citrus that dominate the wine. At the end, a tangy texture offers a tight aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Exuberant White (Minho)

description: A pear-and pineapple-flavored wine, lifted with bright fresh acidity. There is a smooth texture that comes from ripe fruit. Drink now to enjoy its crispness.
title: Casa de Santa Vitoria 2010 Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named after a local landmark, this is rich for a Vinho Verde, a soft blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura that brings out white fruits as well as a more citrus character. It's very aromatic, fruity and worth keeping a few months.
