title: Quintas de Melgaço 2012 Torre de Menagem White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Moscatel in this blend gives an attractive floral perfumed character that balances the crisper Fernão Pires. It is a fruity, light-hearted apéritif-style wine that is ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Deliciously crisp and fruity, this is a bright, clean style of wine not showing much terroir character but is fresh and full of citrus fruits. The acidity gives a refreshing lift at the end.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2013 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: Vineyards in the upper Douro Superior region are able to produce surprisingly fresh and fruity whites like this, despite the heat and dry climate. Old vines go into this yellow and green fruit flavored wine with its lively acidity and totally refreshing palate. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is soft and lightly textured. It has fruit with ripe apricot and white peach flavors that are lifted by the bright citrus aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 White (Alentejano)

description: An easy focus on fruit and flavor is the key to this ripe wine that is full of creamy apple and peach flavors. It is crisp, with plenty of acidity and a delicious, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: This is a very crisp wine dominated by herbaceous notes and intense acidity. It is bright and lively, hinting at spice and toast and tantalizingly fresh on the finish.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe perfumed wine based on Verdelho and Arinto. The blend, which also includes some Antão Vaz, creates a rich character full of juicy apricot and melon fruit shot through with lime zest. It is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Grapes grown at high altitude give the cool feel to this crisp wine. A light touch of oak is revealed in the vanilla flavor that is finely integrated into the citrus and apple fruit. The wine is fruity, ready to drink young.
title: Churchill's 2015 Churchill's Estates Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is soft and ripe. With delicious yellow fruits, a soft texture and just enough lively acidity, it is rich and fruity. There is an attractive orange zing at the end.
title: Colinas do Douro 2014 Branco White (Douro)

description: A rounded wine, this gives pleasure with its pear and ripe apple flavors. Lightly touched with acidity, this has a soft finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from Aveleda's Quinta da Aguieira, this is a blend of typical Portuguese white grapes with a dash of Chardonnay. From old vines, it has concentration and a rich texture that is cut by fragrant acidity. There is a ripe feel to this impressive wine, generous and full of fruit. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Reserva da Familia White (Bairrada)

description: Round and smooth, this has a weighty, full-bodied structure, with the Alvarinho adding a more crisp character. Pear and melon fruits are balanced by citrusy acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Round and soft, this features white fruit flavors filled out by a touch of smokiness and light acidity. It's gentle, dry and full bodied. Screwcap.
designation: Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires
title: Falua 2011 Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: Bright and fruity, this has a ripe applesauce flavor that's cut with citrusy acidity. It's a great apéritif, with a soft texture and refreshing finish.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Alandra Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and crisp, classic dry Vinho Verde, a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, with citrus flavors and a tight texture. Lively and fresh.
title: Borges 2009 AT White (Vinho Verde)

description: A medium-dry Vinho Verde, this is light and fresh without being quite crisp enough. Well chilled, though, it makes a lively and fresh apéritif.
title: Caves Aliança 2009 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: It takes a while for the taste of this light, fresh white to come through. Then, it is soft, creamy textured, flavored with pear juice and lemon zest. It is simple, easy, cleanly made.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada Branco White (Estremadura)

description: A soft wine, creamy and ripe. The flavors are open, with white fruits, green plums, a baked apple character. There is acidity, but with the gentle, ripe fruit, this blends in easily. For early drinking.
title: Borges 2008 Meia Encosta White (Dão)

description: Pure fruit flavors are fresh, but still show the ripeness of 2009. This is a fruity, ready-to-drink wine that has citrus, green plums and fresh acidity.
title: Maritávora 2009 Branco White (Douro)

description: Blending Encruzado and Malvasia Fina, this lightly wood-aged wine is rich, stylish and full of young fruit flavors. Green plums, apricots and a squeeze of lemon all give their bright character to the palate. There is a firm, mineral texture that promises some aging; drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Ribeiro Santo White (Dão)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, a lively, fruity wine that has just a hint of a prickle on the tongue. It has apple and grapefruit flavors that are fresh and deliciously crisp. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe, tropical fruit flavored wine that is both fresh and rich. While produced in an area of Vinho Verde that is predominately dedicated to the Alvarinho grape, this dry wine is a refreshing, bright blend of many of the local varieties. It is juicy, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2015 Muros Antigos Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an unusual white made from red Touriga Nacional and white Tamarez. Bright lemon flavors are balanced by notes of apricot and richer fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Tamarez White (Tejo)

description: This is a bright lemon and grapefruit flavored wine that has lively acidity and the lightest touch of mineral texture. It's crisp, refreshing and will be ready to drink from mid-2016.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, a blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires. Bright and fruity with plenty of citrus freshness, it is lightly crisp and fresh at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 White (Tejo)

description: This is a soft ripe wine that has yellow fruits alongside crisper red apples and touches of grapefruit. That makes for a balanced light wine that has a fine texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monta da Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Produced in the Lima Valley, in the heart of the Vinho Verde region, this is fruity and crisp. It is medium sweet in character, the sweetness balanced by the refreshing acidity and citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft and warm, this is an apricot and pear-flavored wine. It has a soft texture, with a ripe feel that is just lifted by acidity. The aftertaste, with a more citrus character, adds the freshness.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Roupeiro-Antão Vaz White (Alentejo)

description: This is an attractive, lemon and lime-flavored wine. Riper yellow fruits also show through the crisp acidity and the lightly mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Classico Branco White (Tejo)

description: This blend of the white Trincadeira das Pratas and Arinto is soft and perfumed. It has some ripe acidity and an open texture. The aftertaste brings in some attractive melon flavor. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Selection White (Tejo)

description: This ripe wine is smooth and rounded. Its melon and pear flavors give a generous, fruity character. Clean and crisp at the end, finished with acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This ultrayoung wine is all fruit. It is textured with minerality and a chalky character that is keeping the fresh green fruits in balance. The wine is delicious, although really not ready. Better to wait until 2016.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo)

description: This wine reflects the fresh, cool character of Lisboa, with its ocean influence. A tangy, steely edge brings out a mineral character to top up the crisp citrus and apple fruitiness. The wine needs until 2016.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Dory Colheita Branco White (Lisboa)

description: With Encruzado and Malvasia in the blend, it is no surprise this wine is deliciously perfumed. It has fresh acidity as well as ripe apple and pear flavors. The wine is fruity, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Dão)

description: Young and fruity, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine. It has just enough acidity to give a fresh edge to the ripe quince and Rocha pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2014 Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and fresh, with ripe yellow fruits, this is an immediately attractive wine. It has acidity a bright fruitiness from the blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto. The finish is crisp and tangy.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)

description: With Viognier and Sémillon in the blend, this has the potential to be a ripe, smoothly textured wine. Acidity acts as a contrast and gives a tight lemon edge. The wine is still young, with its full fruitiness suppressed. Drink from 2016.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 White (Alentejano)

description: With the classic tongue-tickle of young Vinho Verde, this fresh, crisp and off-dry wine is immediately drinkable. It has ripe orange and sweet citrus fruitiness, and plenty of acidity.
title: Obrigado 2014 Vera Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This juicy wine boasts lemon aromas and bright citrusy acidity, resulting in a light, crisp and bright sip. It has a frest lilt, with an attractive zesty texture. Drink now.
title: Quevedo 2014 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: Aromas of white flowers lead into crisp lemon and grapefruit flavors. This has a fresh tang from the light prickle on the tongue, along with ripe peach and apple skin flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2014 Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto gives a fruity, fresh and fragrant wine, with lively bright acidity. A lemon edge is filled out by ripe apricot flavor, resulting in a rounded finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezirias Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: Here's a bright, slightly sparkling wine, with fresh acidity and an off-dry, fruity character. It has attractive lemon-lime flavors and a salty, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: With its big, fat mouthfeel, but very little fruit to back it up, at this stage this wine seems to be about wood, spice and richness without balance. The Reserva from the property seems to have a better focus.
title: Casa de Santar 2005 Condessa de Santar White (Dão)

description: This is a ripe wine that includes Chardonnay and Viognier in its blend. It has yellow fruits that are cut with plenty of acidity. A cool, crisp element reminds that the vineyards are close to the ocean. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Palha-Canas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Pineapple and mango dominate this full-bodied, ripe wine. Soft and given a lift by lime juice, it is a well-balanced blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This is a soft, lightly aromatic wine with fresh apple and quince flavors. It has light spice, balanced acidity and a mineral streak that gives the wine shape and texture. It is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2016.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Fermentation in oak has given this wine both a toasty aroma and a palate that is spicy in burnt caramel flavors. Yellow fruits are there as well, giving promise for a more balanced future. Drink from 2016.
title: Azamor 2014 Selected White (Alentejano)

description: This is a smooth blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto, with a shot of Alvarinho. It is bright and fruity yet also somewhat creamy. There is a lemon tang to this still young wine. Fresh and fruity at the end, drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana White (Alentejano)

description: Named in homage to a Marquesa de Alorna who was a poet in the 18th century, this wood-aged rich wine is serious and complex. It has ripe yellow fruits that balance with the spice from the wood aging, giving a ripe creamy wine that will still age. Drink from 2017.
designation: Marquesa de Alorna Grande Reserva Branco
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Marquesa de Alorna Grande Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This rich wine has peach and quince flavors along with spice and hints of toast. It's full in the mouth, very fruity and fresh, a warm wine that does manage to keep a fresh burst of lemon acidity at the end. Drink now, but better at the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2012 Sagrado White (Douro)

description: The perfect summer apéritif, this light, fresh, crisp wine tastes just drier than previous vintages, allowing the apple and lemon fruits to shine even more. It has a tight, taut aftertaste, leaving the mouth clean and refreshed. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Delicious citrus and grape juice aromas, with a vivid, lively dry style that explodes with white fruit and lime flavors. The wine is a great apéritif, or with shellfish.
title: Caves da Cerca 2008 Famega White White (Vinho Verde)

description: A crisp, fresh white wine, with clean acidity and a forward, easy lemon and melon character, with a hint of honey from the Malvasia Fina grapes in the blend.
title: Quinta dos Roques 2008 Quinta do Correio White (Dão)

description: A short time in wood has given this wine some extra richness without taking away the fruit. It is a ripe blend of Códega do Larinho, Gouveio and Viosinho, smooth and rich. Acidity, minerality and a fine dash of lemon keep everything fresh.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Douro)

description: Full-bodied and ripe, this is a rich, generous wine that shows complexity as well as subtle fruitiness. A blend of Viosinho and Verdelho, it's full of tropical fruit flavors, with ample weight and concentration. Spicy accents, a dense texture and a fine, long-lasting finish are all part of this stylish wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a deliciously fresh, yet also rounded and rich wine. Creamed apples and soft pears go with a lime juice crispness, resulting in a wine that is ripe, fruity and delicately acidic. Drink now.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2012 Muros Antigos White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp, lemon fresh and fruity, this is an attractive wine to drink now. It has some richness from the mineral texture and the tangy orange edge. The aftertaste continues the fruity theme.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2013 Branco White (Douro)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley. It has a cool, mineral character that suits it well. Fresh with acidity and tight with its chalky texture, it's a delicious wine to drink now, fruity, tangy and complex.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This blend of four grapes, partially fermented in wood, is an immediately attractive wine. Fresh and fruity with only the lightest toasty hints, the wine has citrus acidity, crisp pear and green plum flavors and a zingy, mineral aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Esporão Reserva White (Alentejo)

description: With 50% fermentation, this is a ripe, toasty wine, the wood balanced by a great citric swipe. Bright white fruits and wild flower perfumes give the wine a great lift.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2009 Vinha Grande Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a rich wine that feels full-bodied and with concentration. It has ripe pineapple and tropical fruit flavors as well as fresher citrus acidity. It has also a fine texture that gives the wine great depth and ripeness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Cartuxa 2013 Foral de Evora Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine that is full of fresh white fruit tones on the nose. It has ripe yellow fruits along with crisp lemon and a touch of minerality. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2014 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: Wood-aged, this is a ripe-textured wine that has rich flavors of yellow and white fruits and toast. It has concentrated, intense fruit that bursts in the mouth. Delicious and impressive, this could be aged for another two years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Morgado de Santa Catherina Reserva White (Bucelas)

description: A highly perfumed, lime-dominated wine that gets some freshness from apple skins and high acidity. Its flavors do feel awkward, fresh from the candy shop rather than the vineyard.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This fruity wine, named after the family that owns Rocim, has attractive acidity, spice and delicious citrus flavors. The aftertaste is tangy and zesty. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Alves Vieira Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Antão Vaz and Arinto, two classic white varieties of Alentejo, are blended into this simple, fruity wine. Its acidity and citrus fruitiness have been given weight by lees stirring. The wine is crisp and lively, ready to drink now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)

description: While there is no wood aging in this wine there is some good concentration and richness making it full-bodied, with ripe citrus and minerality. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This has attractive apple and citrus fruits,with a crisp structure and some sweetness on the finish.
title: Cavipor 2011 Vinhas Altas White (Vinho Verde)

description: As bright as a button, this is a crisp, cool wine, lightly herbaceous and deliciously fresh. Just touched by six months wood aging, the wine has an extra layer of richness that contrasts with the young green and citrus fruits. Drink now, or, better, keep until 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2012 Beyra Superior Branco White (Beira Interior)

description: Deliciously aromatic, this is an assertive, fruit-forward wine, with textured minerality. It has yellow fruits that are cut with citrus as well as bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Porca de Murça 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This light and fruity wine has fresh acidity as well as lemon and ripe pear fruits. It is soft, smooth, and with a creamy texture, is very ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This fruity wine has bright acidity and a perfumed character. With its crisp texture, it is full of lemon and green apple fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)

description: From vines on the cool plateau above the Douro, this is a fresh and fruity wine. Light wood-aging is just noticeable, giving a little spice to the textured, steely fruit. Crisp apples and pink grapefruit offer freshness. The wine could age more, so drink from end of 2015.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Reserva White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged Guru is a rich (while lemon- and lime-flavored) spicy wine. It has a strong mineral element with a crisp, tangy, steely character. Its fruitiness is tempered by the complex texture that promises aging for a few years. Drink from 2017.
title: Wine & Soul 2013 Guru White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine is full of toasty fruits and a mineral texture. Ripe apricots and sweet apples give a fruity aspect that is balanced by the toast and spice. Perfumed acidity finishes this wine that suggests further aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: In a reference to the storks who build nests in the chimneys of the Eiffel-designed DFJ winery, Storks Landing shows bright acidity, layers of citrus plus a touch of more exotic pineapple. A blend of Fernão Pires and Chardonnay, it's fresh and light in the mouth, mineral and crisp at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Storks Landing White (Lisboa)

description: The wood aging of this wine has given a lightly oxidized character. It is rich and creamy with toasty acidity as well as yellow fruits. Drink now.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires is aromatic and ripe. Its fruitiness is tropical, with pineapple as well as apricot flavors. It's softly textured  and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco White (Tejo)

description: A fruity, herbaceous wine that is both fresh and rounded. It has clean, bright, green fruit and citrus flavors, resulting in an overall crisp character. It is still settling down and developing its richer side; drink from 2014.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2012 DouRosa Branco White (Douro)

description: An old-vines white wine from the Douro is rare, and this rich wine rewards the winemaker who found the grapes. Aged in wood, ripe and with lemon, peach and grapefruit flavors, it balances richness with a crisp, taut texture. Age this wine a year.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: This is a sweet, lightly sparkling wine. It has crisp apple as well as citrus flavors to contrast with the sweetness. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is perfumed and so soft. It could make a good apéritif with its light texture and equally light acidity. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Monte do Enforcado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Opulent and wood-aged, this feels intense and rounded with a ripe Burgundian feel. The full weight of the peach and apricot fruits are given a powerful push by the toast, spice and vanilla flavors. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2009 Palpite Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine remains a benchmark for the Vinho Verde region, even though the producers have now recast it as a Minho wine. It is steely, tight and crisp, with a touch of creaminess that gives it a more rounded aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.
designation: Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho
title: Aveleda 2013 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Minho)

description: This wine is full and richly fruity. It has a cool feel to it from the proximity of the vines to the ocean, which gives a mineral, crisp character that adds tang to the texture. Acidity lifts the ripe fruit, allowing it to age a few more months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: A lightly wood-aged wine, this is floral and spicy. With its pear and citrus flavors, soft texture and fine mature fruit, it is nicely balanced and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2014 Padre Pedro Reserva Branco Viognier-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: With 15 months of wood aging enhancing the natural richness of old vines, this impressive wine is both spicy and packed with fruit. It is young, still with its bright baby fruit and with acidity that needs to soften. The wine, with its pepper toast flavors as well as its rich apple and citrus fruits, will be best from 2018.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2015 Crooked Vines Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: Ripe, rich and creamy, this is a dense wine from the lees aging. Spice and a touch of toast come from the wood aging that smooths the wine and gives it extra complexity. This is a rich wine, with a tangy aftertaste, that is ready to drink.
title: Borges 2015 Reserva White (Douro)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires where the blend produces a wine that is soft and gently fruity. It has attractive acidity as well as a touch of spice and intense citrus at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: A ripe wine, with white fruits and a touch of spice. The crisp minerality of Vinho Verde is all there, with a satisfyingly textured aftertaste.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2009 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Dão's Encruzado grape gives this wine its rich, yellow fruits and apple flavors. It is still young, textured and fruity. Balanced and very fresh with a tangy, tight texture, this wine will age well. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Somontes Branco Colheita White (Dão)

description: While the aromas of this rich wine suggest a barnyard character, on the palate it is ripe and still young. Yellow fruits dominate with light acidity and a generous structure. At the end, the wine is full, opulent and needing to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2013 Duas Quintas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Blending Fernão Pires and Sauvignon Blanc from the Casal Branco estate, this is a crisp wine that is full of white fruit flavors, hints of pineapple and an herbal edge. It is bright, light and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Capoeira Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a stylish, ripe wine. Pineapple and apricot flavors lend a rich yet fresh feel to the wine. Lemon and lime give a crisp finish. It's tangy and structured, better to drink from 2016.
title: Adega Mayor 2014 Monte Mayor White (Alentejano)

description: Here is a ripe, full-bodied wine that brings out the minerality of the Douro terroir. It is structured and textured, with a strongly tangy character. Acidity and bright lemon flavors are still young and need some aging, so drink from 2016.
designation: Santos da Casa Fazem Milagres Branco
title: Casca Wines 2014 Santos da Casa Fazem Milagres Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a delicious, fruity wine, a blend of Arinto and Viognier. The Viognier does bring its trademark apricot flavor and creamy texture while the Arinto adds the bright acidity, citrus and crisp apples. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2016 Private Selection White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is soft and full bodied, with a ripe yellow-fruit flavor and a hint of spice that merge with the rounded texture. The acidity just surfaces on the finish.
title: Parras Vinhos 2010 Pera Doce Branco Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: This is an impressive wine. It's so balanced between opulent ripe fruit and a tight texture. Wood aging complements the rich apricot and crisp apple flavors, adding spice and a touch of pepper. The more juicy nature of the wine comes through as it opens up; however, it does need to age more. so wait until 2017.
title: Luis Duarte 2014 Rubrica Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of five grapes, including Sauvignon Blanc, this is a crisp, kiwi- and grapefruit-flavored wine. It is bright, fruity and tangy, and it has a soft, cantaloupe-tasting finish. Ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Espirito Branco White (Tejo)

description: Toast, spice and juicy citrus flavors blend together in this crisp wine. Its acidity is prominent, giving plenty of freshness to a wine that is also tangy. With the toastiness now well integrated, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: A soft open blend of Fernão Pires and Verdelho produces a spicy wine with floral acidity, white-flower aromas and ripe fruitiness. It is an easy blend, refreshing and ready to drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Serras de Azeitão White (Península de Setúbal)

description: The wine is soft, creamy and ripe. It has white fruits and just enough acidity. With its lightly perfumed character, apricot and green fruits in balance, it is ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: Produced from an estate on the border with Spain, this rich blend of Viognier and Alvarinho with Arinto and Antão Vaz is generous and full bodied. Yellow fruits, a rich texture and a touch of spice give the wine its warm character. Drink from 2018.
designation: Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Branco
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fruity and intense, this is a very fine Vinho Verde from the northern vineyards of the region. It is full, packed with pear, lemon meringue and grapefruit flavors, feeling rich as well as crisp. A wine like this can age, so drink until 2017.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2012 Muros Antigos Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a rich Chardonnay and Arinto blend with a ripe texture and fruit. Aging on the lees has given the wine that extra concentration and depth of flavor. That goes with the apricot and peach fruits and the tight acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: A wood- aged wine that is ripe and smooth. It has only the barest hint of toastiness, the wood serving more to fill out the rich fruitiness. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Poças 2014 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: The combination of Chardonnay and Arinto seems to work so well. It gives a rich wine that has just the right edge of fresh acidity and crisp apple flavors. A creaminess rounds this wine out, leaving a fresh, rich aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2013 Margaride's White (Tejo)

description: The Chardonnay in this blend was fermented and aged in wood and then combined with crisp Arinto fermented in tank. The result is a lightly oaked wine that has yellow fruits as well as crisper citrus. It is a finely made, ripe wine that will be ready to drink from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: A lively, fresh wine, whose wood aging has just enhanced the delicious fruit flavors of mango and pineapple. The acidity bounces up and down, vibrant and crisp. Considering its origin in one of the hottest regions of the Douro, this is impressive.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Côa White (Douro)

description: An opulently ripe, wood-aged wine that's both fruity and textured. It has weight, richness, a lightly mineral texture with crisp apple and green plum flavors. Give this attractive while serious wine until the end of 2014.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2012 Malhadinha Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Wood aging shows strongly throughout this wine. With its blend of Viosinho, Encruzado with a dash of Chardonnay, it has weight and richness. A creamy character comes from the wood and the ripe yellow fruits are developing well. Hold to 2015.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 CSL Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Lightly gold in color, it has a touch of botrytis to give a honeyed character. The wine is full and rich, with an element of dryness at its heart.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Colheita Tardia White (Tejo)

description: The name is not a Portuguese greeting, but a blending of Alvarinho and Loureiro, the grapes in the wine. It is a rich, juicy wine full of apricot, apple and pear flavors. It has just the right amount of tangy texture and refreshing acidity. The wine is fruity, perfumed and bright.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Allo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly sweet, this is a refreshing, fruity wine. It's a great apéritif for the summer with its ripe lemon and grapefruit that are given a push by the softer green plum  fruits. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Chardonnay with Arinto and Vital, this is a simple, fruity and fragrant wine. It has lively acidity, a crisp, mineral texture and a ripe, full feel at the end. Drink through 2015.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Forgotten Field White (Lisboa)

description: This is a fruity style of Vinho Verde that also brings out the crispest citrus and pink grapefruit flavors. The wine, with its light spritz, is fresh, full of acidity and just off dry. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2013 Raza White (Vinho Verde)

description: This young, fruity wine is crisp with acidity and light in texture. The wine is bright and lively, ready to drink for its fruitiness.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: A wood-aged white with light toast character to complement the creamy pear and melon flavors. It is full in the mouth, rounded and soft.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2008 Vila Santa White (Alentejano)

description: This blend of perfumed Verdelho and crisp Alvarinho belies the Alentejo heat. It's powered by its fruitiness, with zesty lemon, lime and apricot flavors, its texture still firm with minerality. Drink this rich wine from 2018.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 White (Alentejano)

description: Rounded and fruity, the wine is soft and full in the mouth. Lively acidity gives a textured aftertaste that brings out yellow fruits.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 Fonte da Serrana White (Alentejano)

description: Citrus and apple freshness mark this wine, which is bright and lively while also having some fruit weight. Not for aging.
title: Quinta da Plansel 2010 Plansel Selecta Branco White (Alentejano)

description: With some fermentation in barrel, this wood-touched wine is rounded as well as fruity. Citrus and pineapple flavors give liveliness, with acidity cutting through the spice. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Ramos-Pinto's two estates of Bons Aires and Ervamoira provide the grapes for this fruity, smooth-textured white wine. While this selection reflects the warmth of the Douro, it also shows great citrusy freshness and a crisp finish. Ready to drink.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Duas Quintas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This ripe, fruity wine has a hint of wood, fine acidity, a soft, creamy texture and an attractive burst of lime juice flavor. The finish is warm and rich, marked by good acidity.
title: Campolargo 2010 Diga? Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This is a fruity wine that has fresh, lemony crispness to balance the sweet-fruit palate. Bright and clean, it is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2014 Anjos White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is soft and bland, just hinting at fruit and acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Portuga White (Lisboa)

description: This oak-aged wine is rich and concentrated. It is dominated by spice from the wood and by generous white-stone-fruit flavors. Still young, this ripe wine will develop well over the next few years. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Esporão Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A deliciously fresh and soft young wine, it is just off dry: really more light and crisp. Lemon and tight citrus flavors are lifted by a prickle on the tongue. This is a perfect summer drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Arinto and perfumed Verdelho, the wine is ripe with yellow fruits and pear. It has spice and a clean, clear texture that is immediately attractive and drinkable. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Santa Vitória Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fragrant and fruity, this very fresh wine has a strong mineral texture. The freshness gives way to a deeper, rich sense that brings out a more creamy character. It's ripe and rich at the end.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2013 Aphros Ten White (Vinho Verde)

description: Intense and crisp, it shows bright fruits and some weight as well. A touch of yellow fruits give the grapefruit a warmer character and good depth of flavor. It's a Vinho Verde for cooler days, ripe and ready for food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Maria Papoila Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: White peach aromas give a warm feeling. It has fine acidity as well, bursting with fruit and with just a touch of toast. It's ready to drink but will benefit by holding until 2015 in bottle.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2013 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional White (Tejo)

description: Even in the Vinho Verde region, specific vineyards can produce luscious sweet wines such as this. Honeyed and layered with delicious acidity, this is a very fine wine, worth aging for a year or two, but ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2011 Ameal S.H. White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: With Verdelho and Viognier in the blend, this attractive wine has a ripe perfumed character. It also has a crisp side with its lemon fruits that contrast with the spicy pear and melon. It is ready to drink, bright and crisp at the end.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and soapy, this is a simple wine without much character. It's a light, slightly sweet wine to be drunk this year. Screwcap.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This late-harvest wine has hints of honeyed botrytis as well as apricot fruitiness, though it is far from cloyingly sweet. The texture is soft and mature, with good integration of the fruit and the botrytis character. Try it now with cheese or foie gras.
title: Global Wines 2012 Outono de Santar White (Dão)

description: Here is a lightly sparkling, just off-dry Vinho Verde, the sort of wine that just goes down as an apéritif or, in Portugal, with sardines. It's a crisp, bright wine, a lemon curd flavor finishing the apple fruitiness.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2013 Paço de São Lourenço Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a generous blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Perrum (aka Pedro Ximenez). It is finely perfumed, full of juicy white fruits that are shot through with lemon juice. This is a wine to drink young and now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a balanced blend of Rabo de Ovelha and Roupeiro grapes. They give the wine both its crisp acidity and its ripe white-fruit flavors. The acidity and the texture suggest the wine should age for a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Vila Santa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is dominated by perfumed Malvasia. That gives the wine its deliciously scented apples and pears. The texture—lightly mineral—adds a piquancy to this ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

description: This is a fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest. It is a refreshing wine with an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste. Drink this lively wine now.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: This superrich wine is full of intense yellow fruit and passion-fruit flavors. The fruit is underlined with wood aging, with toast and spice. The aftertaste, smooth and creamy, shows the wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade Grande 2016 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This is a delicious, ripe wine inspired by its Sémillon and Viognier. The lemon and grapefruit acidity is contrasted with the rich white stone fruits and warmth of this region. Drink from 2018.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: This is fairly typical, light, fruity lemon-driven Vinho Verde. It has a light spritz, and is exuberantly fresh with just a touch of ripeness and crisp, cool acidity. Perfect to drink this summer.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Citrus fruitiness and mineral acidity that mark Douro character is balanced by a hint of toast from 50% of the wine being aged in oak. Drink this tight nervy wine from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Vinha da Urze Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: With its crisp and strongly mineral character, this is true terroir wine. It is stony, steely, very textured, with the apple skin and strong pink grapefruit citrus flavors pushing through to give a fresh character at the end. The structure shows the wine needs to age, so drink from late 2015.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Terroir White (Minho)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and full of tropical fruits as well as a light touch of toast. Crisp acidity lies in the background, giving freshness to the natural ripeness of the fruits. It's still young, still showing a strong, tangy texture, so wait to drink until 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Full of ripe tropical fruits, this is rich and opulent. Apricot, mango and peach all feature along with spice from wood aging. All this ripe fruit is balanced by fresher acidity. It's a powerful wine touched with pepper, full in the mouth and packed with fruit and toast. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A fruity blend of local Lisboa grapes along with Chardonnay, this wine is rich and full of citrus and crisp apple flavors. It is a ripe wine with a creamy texture enhanced by toast from the wood aging. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Premium Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Rich, flowery wine that shows the potential for white wines in the Dão region. While it keeps plenty of lemon zest acidity, the apricot and peach flavors combine well with pears. There is spice from wood, but the fruit is the thing with this great food wine.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada White (Dão)

description: Light, fruity and off dry, this is a fresh and crisp wine. It has sweetened lemon juice flavors that are cut by intense, young acidity. Balanced and ready to drink now.
designation: Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a juicy, ripe style of Vinho Verde that's soft, clean and refreshing. It's a summer-evening wine, light and bright. Screwcap.
title: Calamares 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Pato's pair of old vine wines, a red and this white, are beautifully complex. With its rich melon, tropical fruits, spice and light toastiness, this wine is concentrated with still-young acidity and currant fruit flavors. It's a great wine that needs to develop before drinking. Wait until 2016.
title: Luis Pato 2013 Vinhas Velhas White (Beira Atlantico)

description: A very spicy, wood-aged wine that has swathes of very ripe yellow fruits with almost sweet acidity. The fruits have weight, density and a toasty aftertaste. This impressive wine could wait and be drunk from 2016.
title: Quanta Terra 2012 Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine brings together some of the freshest of Portuguese white grapes along with Sauvignon Blanc. It's a surprisingly successful blend, with toast that smoothes out the herbaceous, crisp character of the fruit and adds some apricot highlights. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2013 Estate Collection White (Lisboa)

description: This is a wood aged wine, full of vanilla flavors as well as fragrant fruitiness. It has great flavor intensity, with bright notes of juicy green plum and grapefruit that are framed by acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It needs some years aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Poeira 2014 White (Douro)

description: A wood-aged white, spicy and ripe. It has just the right balance of acidity to go with the ripe green plum and melon fruits. With a great bite of acidity to finish, this is a wine that will age for 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A smooth wine that is very fruity while also rich. A ripe feel comes from the dominant Viosinho in the blend. There is a greener element, lightly tangy and herbaceous that gives a fresher aftertaste to this attractive wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Perfumed floral and spice aromas give this wine its great character. It is a rich blend of Viosinho, Alvarinho and Chardonnay, ripe and full of spice, rounded apple and golden-plum flavors and cut with citrus acidity. This fine wine will be better from 2018.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Dory Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Crisp lemon and green apple flavors shine through this lively, fruity wine. It has a cool character, tangy fruitiness and a touch of pepper. The wine is made to drink in its youth and is ready now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Maria Papoila White (Vinho Verde)

description: This ripe wine is full of apple fruits with a tight streak of citrus acidity. It's a food wine, showing a creamy texture, a light texture and attractive acidity.
title: Poças 2012 Coroa d'Ouro White (Douro)

description: This rich, wood-aged blend dominated by Viosinho is spicy with a ripe toastiness. The acidity highlights this impressively stylish wine through the tangy, fruit finish. Drink after 2018.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: A crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde with a good prickle on the tongue. Flavors of lemon and green apple are well balanced in this ready-to-drink summer wine. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Loureiro from the best parcels of Calçada estate. That gives it gravitas, that also comes through strongly from the wood aging. Vanilla and green fruits complement each other, leaving a wine that is both rich and fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2012 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: The wine is off dry, fruity and refreshing. It has lively citrus acidity as well as sliced apple crispness. The wine has the lightest prickle on the tongue, leaving a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Tiroliro White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is dry and surprisingly rich for a Vinho Verde. It has pineapple and peach as well as the more familiar citrus and green fruit flavors. With lively acidity at the end, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an off-dry wine, full of fruit and crisp acidity. It has a soft texture and touches of tropical fruit. The wine comes from vineyards in the south of Vinho Verde, close to the Douro.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Vilacetinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: Blending Chardonnay and Viognier with local grapes, the wine is smooth and creamy. It has apple and bright citrus flavors with a cool, crisp backdrop of acidity. The aftertaste, with its tangy, salty character is a reminder of the ocean climate of the region.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Palha-Canas White (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, full wine, retaining Vinho Verde's classic taut acidity, but rounded out with sweet apple and lime flavors. It's food friendly and would make for a fine apéritif.
title: Casa do Valle 2011 White (Vinho Verde)

description: High-elevation vineyards produce the fruit for this crisp, herbaceous wine. It has flavors of ripe gooseberry and lime, with a light hint of nutmeg, immediately appealing in its fruitiness.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Dourosa Branco White (Douro)

description: This very fruity wine oozes fresh apricot and elegant peach flavors. It's crisp and fragrant, a fine, ready-to-drink blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Arinto.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2011 Guadalupe Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A fresh, fruity lemon and pink grapefruit flavored wine, this is brightly full of acidity; a crisp and mineral texture creates a refreshing character. Ready to drink.
title: Félix Rocha 2012 Quinta de São Cristóvão White (Lisboa)

description: From 1800-foot vineyards, this is a crisp, cool, simply fruity wine that has great citrus and lemon character. Very aromatic, with green herb and fresh grapefruit zest over apple juice.
title: Niepoort 2009 Tiara White (Douro)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. Melon, pear and apricots come together in a fruit cocktail of a lively, crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is crisp, herbal and lightly textured. Lemon and grapefruit dominate the final acidity. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)

description: The white wine in a new duo of branded wines called Loios, this is a simple citrus- and apple-flavored wine, relatively fat and full, but leaving enough fresh acidity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Loios White (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich wine, smoky with vanilla and apple flavors. It has some good intensity, as well as a textured character that gives it some aging potential. Bright, fresh acidity cuts through the riper fruits. Drink now and until 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This dry Vinho Verde shows great crisp, green apple and grapefruit flavors, a deliciously fresh wine, with green edges and lively flavors. Great summer drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Grown on the plateau above the Douro valley, this wine is rich, generous and finely balanced. Green plum and citrus acidity are dominant, while ripe melon and spice grace the finish. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced from high-altitude (1,800 feet) vines, this wine is ripe while also crisply fresh. Its lime and lemon flavors are balanced by the mineral texture and intense final acidity. Drink now.
designation: Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco
title: Van Zellers 2015 Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco White (Douro)

description: Smooth and rounded with light, perfumed sweetness, this is an easy and approachable wine. Its pear and kiwi flavors come together easily. Screwcap.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2011 Hera White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wood aging is still showing in the aroma of the wine. On the palate, the fruitiness of the blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Viognier comes across richly with flavors of apricots, green plums and pink grapefruit. This fruitiness is layered over the wood spice to give a creamy wine that will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Luis Duarte 2014 Monte de Carrapatelo Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Aged three months in wood, there is a noticeable amount of toast and spice in this wine. That balances the blend of Chardonnay and Antão Vaz, yielding a smooth character of bright fruit flavors blending with warm apricot notes. Drink from 2017.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 Adega de Pegões Colheita Seleccionada White (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Smooth and light, it's all about fruitiness, crisp apples and a squeeze of lemon juice that perks up the soft texture. It's fresh and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Perfumed and exotic, the wine has a touch of lychee as well as fresh acidity, both given lift by a lemon zest flavor. With a crisp aftertaste, it's a lively wine for drinking now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Parcelas White (Douro)

description: This blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is soft, fresh and fruity. Juicy green plums, citrus and bright acidity all give a lively character. A tangy texture needs several months aging. It will be best at the end of the 2014.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This crisp, herbaceous selection is a blend of Rabigato and other rarer varieties. It has a citrus note and lively acidity, with deep apple and pear flavors. There's a tangy, steely edge that suggests that the wine will age.
title: Muxagat 2011 Mux Branco White (Douro)

description: A typical local blend of Arinto, Fernão Pires and Chardonnay, this is smooth, ripe and creamy. It has touches of herb, honey and pineapple, which are laced together by citrusy acidity. The finish is soft.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Aromatic, tropical textured wine. Great flavors of ripe pineapple and mango balance with more green fruit characters and a twist of lime. The wood flavors are well restrained, offering just a touch of final spice.
title: Fiuza 2008 Ikon Chardonnay/Trincadeira White (Tejo)

description: Lively and crisp, this has some good concentration and almond and creamy flavors over new wood. It shows ripe fruit, but there is also a zesty lemon character that gives it a lift and vibrancy. Deliciously refreshing.
title: Castello d'Alba 2006 Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: A lightly toasty character shows this has been subtly aged in wood. It adds spice, a creamy texture and richness to what is already a finely balanced wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho-Viognier Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This is a balanced wine that has attractive citrus flavors, riper peach and pineapple and a light apricot perfume from the Viognier in the blend. It is rich while having plenty of freshness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Estate Collection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a finely balanced, rich wine. Bringing together Antão Vaz, Arinto and Roupeiro, the wine is packed with white fruits and a citrus twist. It has a crisp edge and bright acidity although with an underlying richness that makes the wine ideal for spicy foods. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Esporão Reserva White (Alentejo)

description: This floral, fresh wine has great acidity over its apple and intense citrus flavors and stays very fresh to the finish. Clean, fragrant and ready to drink, it is delicious now.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2011 Van Zellers White (Douro)

description: From vineyards in the southern Minho, close to the Douro Valley, this blend of Loureiro and Arinto is rich and full in the mouth. It has spice from wood aging as well as crisp apple and pear flavors that are laced with pink grapefruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: Spicy wood-aging flavors dominate this wine. It is rich, almost too rich and pushy for its own good, seeming to be more opulent than previous vintages. Nutmeg dominates more than the pineapple and apricot fruit flavors. It could settle down, although it will always be larger than life.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Mirabilis Grand Reserva White (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe wine, very balanced and integrated. It conveys yellow fruits along with tangerine and juicy pear. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from mid-2017.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2015 Lybra Viognier-Arinto-Marsanne White (Lisboa)

description: This blend includes the Rhône varietal Roussanne among the Portuguese grapes. The wine has a lightly honeyed character as well as rich yellow and stewed-pear flavors. A touch of toastiness and almonds comes through the rich fruits and acidity. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2015 Estate Collection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Due to its location near the western end of the Douro vineyards, this vineyard makes very fine white wines. This one is at the top, with wood fermentation and aging giving richness, intense flavors and a fine structure. It's a wine that demands serious aging—ripe and full of zesty acidity as well as toast and spice flavors. Start drinking this impressive wine from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Rede 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is soft, lightly textured and perfumed. It has yellow fruits and ripe pear flavors along with a touch of ginger and spice. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2014 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada White (Bairrada)

description: Almost bubbly with a lively mousse, this is a tangy citrus and apple flavored wine that is unfortunately unbalanced with an artificial sweetness at the end.
title: Campelo 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A light and gently fruity perfumed wine, this has easy flavors of spice, pears and soft acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Branco White (Tejo)

description: Based on Cercial, here is a rounded, smooth wine with a delicious perfume. Warm, ripe and delicious, this shows wood hints, peaches and green herbs. Keep for a year.
title: Campolargo 2009 Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This is a rich wine, a reminder of the warmth of the Alentejo. That's reinforced by the cork label made from the other major product of the region. It is perfumed, smooth and with hints of apricots as well as brighter pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 São Miguel do Sul White (Alentejano)

description: This is a fresh, fruity and juicy wine. Shot through with citrus flavors, it is light and crisp. The wine has a nervy texture that gives a great lift on the finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Espaço Rural 2014 Bojador Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Made in a richer style, it is bone dry and with a creamy texture, apricot fruit flavors as well as the right, crisp acidity. The wine is fresh, fruity and, of course, needs to be drunk now.
title: LIV 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Moscatel in this blend shows strongly, bringing out perfumed aromas. The wine has spice, light acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Gâmbia 2012 White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Produced in central Alentejo in the warm region of Redondo, this is a surprisingly cool, crisp wine. Its blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto give plenty of acidity and citrus flavors. Green plum adds an extra richness. Drink this wine now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive blend of grapes from different regions of Portugal. It is light, with crisp acidity and refreshing lemon fruit. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This is a rich, fruity wine that has a delicious apple flavor cut by lemony acidity to give a line of freshness. The wine is dry, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa do Valle 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a ripe and lightly honeyed wine. It has an aromatic character that translates onto the palate in ripe mango, peach and apple flavors. There is a good texture, tangy and rich. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Paseo of Portugal White (Lisboa)

description: Made from old vines, this is a fruity yet concentrated wine. It is rich and creamy, cut by sliced apple freshness. There is a typical Douro minerality that comes from the rocks of the region. Drink this wine from 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Branco White (Douro)

description: Grown on the plateau above the Douro valley, this wine is rich, generous and finely balanced. Green plum and citrus acidity are dominant, while ripe melon and spice grace the finish. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced from high-altitude (1,800 feet) vines, this wine is ripe while also crisply fresh. Its lime and lemon flavors are balanced by the mineral texture and intense final acidity. Drink now.
designation: Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco
title: Van Zellers 2015 Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco White (Douro)

description: The powerful herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc dominates, giving a bitter character to this wine and leaving the gentle crispness of Arinto in its wake. Maybe a year will help.
title: Casal do Conde 2012 White (Tejo)

description: This is a wine that brings out the fine minerality of Dão whites. It is crisp while at the same time full and ripe. There is a smooth texture that comes from the Encruzado in the blend, with lively acidity coming from Gouveio. This wine will benefit from a few months in bottle, so drink from summer 2016.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2014 Mondeco Branco White (Dão)

description: A blend of grapes from the north of the Vinho Verde region, this is tangy and crisp. It is bright and dry with attractive acidity and a lemon zest texture. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Trinca Espinhas Alvarinho-Trajadura White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Encruzado and Gouveio, this soft, young and fruity wine will be fine and ripe by 2016. The palate integrates a mineral texture and fresh citrus flavors that are tight and need to round out. It's a finely structured wine that finishes with a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2014 Quinta do Mondego White (Dão)

description: With 15 months of wood aging enhancing the natural richness of old vines, this impressive wine is both spicy and packed with fruit. It is young, still with its bright baby fruit and with acidity that needs to soften. The wine, with its pepper toast flavors as well as its rich apple and citrus fruits, will be best from 2018.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2015 Crooked Vines Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: While still light, this Vinho Verde has a creamy texture and a sense of richness. It blends two of the quality grapes of the region, Alvarinho and Loureiro. Together they make an aromatic, intense and tangy wine that is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Maria Papoila White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wood-aged wine is spicy, ripe, packed with rich yellow fruits and finished with acidity. It is beautifully balanced, the spice and toast well integrated with the fruit. Drink this still-young, tangy wine from late 2018.
title: Espaço Rural 2016 Poento Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth, oily-textured ripe wine, stylish and flavorsome. The melon and apple flavors are counterbalanced by a rich acidity, a dense structure and a vanilla hint.
title: Quevedo 2010 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto produces a rich and creamy wine with pear, ripe apple and apricot flavors. A floral character gives extra piquancy.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo)

description: Simple, fruity lemon-and melon-flavored wine. The acidity is well integrated with the more rounded texture, finishing soft and fruity.
title: Finisterra 2009 Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a pétillant off-dry wine. It has a soapy character that is lifted by citrus fruits, a crisp texture and lively acidity. Drink immediately.
title: Caves Aliança 2016 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: Kerosene aromas and a perfumed character come from the Malvasia in the blend. It is a perfumed wine with touches of green fruits and acidity. The wine doesn't quite hang together.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Colheita White (Douro)

description: This is a beautifully ripe, tangy wine with fine acidity and hints of spice. Lemon and crisp green apple notes shine through the still tight, mineral texture. The concentration of the fruit suggests it will age well. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2015 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Moscatel in the blend of this wine gives it a perfumed character. The wine is soft, gently ripe and with pleasing acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Dona Helena Coheita White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Crisply aromatic, this is a light, bright wine. Citrus fruit and a tangy orange and mineral texture create a light, bright aftertaste. It is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote White (Douro)

description: This bright, tangy wine offers crisp acidity and plenty of herbal, green fruitiness. It is light and ready to drink.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2016 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a simple, soft wine, open and fruity. Muted citrus flavors are highlighted by orange zest and light acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Nana Branco White (Tejo)

description: With the normally more northern Alvarinho in the blend, this wine has considerable freshness. That is mitigated by the wood aging that has broadened the wine and brought out tropical and yellow fruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Branco Reserva White (Alenteo)

description: This is a pale colored wine, a blend of local grapes and deliciously fresh. It is rounded and smooth, touched by citrus and fresh tangerines. Ripe and fruity, it is ready to drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This wine is a great mix of fruit and a tight texture. The two are joined easily by the wood-aging flavors that give a smoky character as well as toastiness. The citrus and crisp peach skin acidity leave a lively aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2012 Conceito White (Douro)

description: Rounded, soft creamy wine, attractively fruity with yellow fruits and bright acidity. It's easy, the freshness naturally integrated with the soft fruit. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Fresh and fruity with a crisp mineral and textured character, this is a lively wine that's ready to drink. Acidity and a citrus zestiness give a refreshing lightness at the end.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of Viosinho and Verdelho, this a soft and ripe wine that has attractive pear, melon and gentle acidity. A light perfume from the Verdelho adds to the attractiveness of this fruity wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: This is an unusual white made from red Touriga Nacional and white Tamarez. Bright lemon flavors are balanced by notes of apricot and richer fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Tamarez White (Tejo)

description: This is a bright lemon and grapefruit flavored wine that has lively acidity and the lightest touch of mineral texture. It's crisp, refreshing and will be ready to drink from mid-2016.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: The second white wine of Poeira, this is all fruit. It has crisp acidity, citrus and green plum flavors along with a brilliant, steely texture. It is much too young to drink with its structure and tight character, so enjoy from late 2016.
title: Poeira 2014 Pó de Poeira White (Douro)

description: This delicious blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura comes from the northern part of the Vinho Verde region. The flavors are ripe yet crisp, with notes of apple and pink grapefruit. The acidity is prominent, yet well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Provam 2014 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a superripe wine, full of generous white and yellow stone fruits. It is soft while also dense with smooth fruits, touched by pepper and nutmeg and given richness from lees aging. Drink the wine now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2016 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This citrus-flavored wine is crisp and fresh with intense lemon and grapefruit. The mineral texture gives the wine its refreshing zing while the fine fruitiness means the wine is really ready to drink when young.
title: Mouchão 2016 Dom Rafael Branco White (Alentejo)

description: An all-embracing blend of many of the white Douro varieties, this is all about fruit. From the crisp citrus flavors to the softer melon and pear, the wine is delicious to drink at this young exuberant stage. It could also keep a few months when the acidity will have calmed down a little.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Vallado Branco White (Douro)

description: A whole slew of adjectives beginning with the letter F are used by the producer to describe this wine. It is a gently sparkling, off-dry wine that has attractive acidity and a touch of citrus. It needs to be enjoyed now, well chilled for a warm day.
title: Aveleda 2014 F Vine White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly fizzy, this is a crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde. It has candied lemon flavors that are shot through with acidity, finishing bright and brisk. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Toucas White (Vinho Verde)

description: A medium-sweet wine, with a light prickle on tongue, very much in the style of some Vinho Verde, this is crisp, with lemon candy flavors and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Azulejo White (Lisboa)

description: This field blend of old white-grape vines—a rarity in the Douro—is rich in the bottle from a mélange of stainless steel, wood fermentation and barrel aging. It is smooth with concentration from the toast flavors and floral complexity. Its ripe character and generous texture make it a wine to drink now.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2015 Pôpa Black Edition Branco White (Douro)

description: This smooth, wood-aged wine is impressively ripe and stylish. Yellow fruit and pear flavors are spiced with nutmeg and toast from the wood, giving richness and a ripe character that are balanced by acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Carvalhas Branco White (Douro)

description: For a Vinho Verde, this is rich and full-bodied, showing delicious acidity, crisp apples and a touch of tropical fruit. There's the typical prickle on the tongue that brings out freshness, but in fact this wine could age for a year.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a ripe, wood aged wine that has great structure as well as ample fruit flavor. It has a touch of toastiness—50% is aged in oak—although it is sophisticated and subtle. Apple, fresh apricot and green plum flavors show through the still young texture. All native grapes—35% Viosinho, 35% Rabigato and other locals from the estate—are the same used for Port blends. To bring out the richer, more rounded side of this wine, wait until 2017 to enjoy.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: With aromas of superripe fruit, this wood aged wine has a rich, toasty and lightly oxidized character, which in this case adds complexity. It is tangy and aromatic, with pear and citrus flavors that harmonize with the spicy wood accents. It is ready to drink.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2011 Vinhas Velhas Branco White (Douro)

description: Delicious and wood-aged , this is a cool wine from a hot place. With as much citrus as tropical fruits, it is crisp, fresh, cut with refreshing acidity that contrasts with the toast and minerality. The wine could be drunk now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Muxagat 2013 Branco White (Douro)

description: As young as it comes, this spicy wine has melon and peppered pear flavors. Its fruit is right up front, almost too much at this stage. It needs to calm down a little, so it will be better drunk from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2016 White (Douro)

description: This is a deliciously aromatic wine, bursting with bright fruits, acidity, all held together with a soft texture. The wine is easy to drink and ready now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Espirito Lagoalva Sauvignon-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: This blend of the local white grapes has been given a herbal twist with Sauvignon Blanc. It is fruity and still young with its lively acidity and crisp texture. Drink from the end of 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Talhão 1 White (Tejo)

description: A soft, fruity wine made from Fernão Pires and Arinto grapes. It has the lightest fruit, gently crisp acidity and a final burst of citrus. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Classico Branco White (Tejo)

description: This wine is bright, fragrant and fruity, with a clean green-fruit and citrus character that's lively and attractive.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This is a densely textured wine. It has a strong sense of minerality, while also having a fruitier side. Ripe acidity and a crisp citrus flavor are allied to the warmer apple and green-plum fruits. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Alvarinho-Trajadura Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an impressively complex Vinho Verde, obviously made for food. With its tangy acidity and tense mineral texture, this blend of a range of the regional grapes is structured and with a delicious, refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa do Valle 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A smooth and ripe blend of Viosinho, Rabigato and Gouvelo, the wine has attractive, smooth apple and pear flavors as well as tangy acidity. With its light touch of acidity at the end, the wine is delicious and ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2016 Encostas do Douro White (Douro)

description: It is probably the small soupçon of Moscatel in the blend that gives this wine its irresistible perfumed character. That just brings out the fine acidity and the crisp citrus flavors. It is a refreshing wine, as aromatic at the end as at the beginning. Drink now.
title: Duorum 2016 Tons de Duorum White (Douro)

description: A short time in oak has done this wine no end of good. It has given it a lightly toasty character, a spicy character and a good depth of fruit flavor. It is rich and will be better from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2016 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A touch of wood goes well with the ripe fruit. It is full in the mouth, rich and needing to age another few months. Yellow fruits and a ripe texture give an imposing presence. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2011 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced from the Boavista vineyard at the base of Casa Santos Lima, this wine comes from old vines. It is a serious, complex and structured wine that will develop well over many years. Dark fruits, dense tannins and really fresh acidity are integrated into a fine wine. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Moscatel, this is fresh, crisp and perfumed. It's an apéritif-like wine, with light acidity and a creamy, smooth texture.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: Very New World in its ripe, tropical fruit flavors, rounded toasty element, and impressive concentration. Yet the elegance also remains, finishing with spice and light acidity, adding shape to this rich wine.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2006 Private Selection Reserva White (Alentejo)

description: A deliciously fresh wine, the bright acidity coming from green fruit and peaches. A creamy character adds a sense of roundness, but there is a crisp, taut aftertaste.
title: Kopke 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This dry Vinho Verde shows great crisp, green apple and grapefruit flavors, a deliciously fresh wine, with green edges and lively flavors. Great summer drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend encourages the richness of the Chardonnay and the crispness of the Arinto. Wood-aging smoothes things out and brings a touch of ginger as well as toast. The wine is full on the mouth and still young. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A soft, rounded melon and pear flavored wine. Very fruity, it is rich, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Monte da Cal Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This single vineyard Vinho Verde is complex and powerful. The texture is creamy, rich, with hints of pineapple as well as grapefruit. There is an edgy texture, balanced with the crispest final acidity.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta de Simaens White (Vinho Verde)

description: A soft style of Vinho Verde that is open and rounded. There is, of course, plenty of crisp citrus fruits, but these are accompanied by riper yellow fruits and a gentle texture. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Vera 2012 White (Vinho Licoroso)

description: This is an intensely fruity wine that is lemon scented, crisp and very fresh. It has a strong citrus flavor, with touches of orange zest and red apples. Not for aging, this light, bright wine is ready to drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a light, fresh and crisply fruity wine. It is dominated by lime and ripe lemon flavors that come from the bright blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto. Not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is heavily wood dominated. Toast and juice come from wood as much as fruit at this stage. Behind this, generous yellow fruits and a ripe, full-bodied character will lead to a ripe and complex wine. It needs aging, so don't drink before 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Secretum
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Secretum White (Douro)

description: An opulently ripe, wood-aged wine that's both fruity and textured. It has weight, richness, a lightly mineral texture with crisp apple and green plum flavors. Give this attractive while serious wine until the end of 2014.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2012 Malhadinha Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is an orange wine, fermented in open tanks. Flavors of oranges and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. The wine has a tight texture as well as spice and hints of its wood aging. Drink from 2017.
designation: Herdade São Miguel Art. Terra Curtimenta
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade São Miguel Art. Terra Curtimenta White (Alentejano)

description: An attractively perfumed wine, it is lively with bright acidity, yello fruits and crisp citrus. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 EA Branco White (Alentejano)
